description:
Chef/owner Prem is an amazing guy! Extremely friendly, he is always around, checking in with every single guest. I came with my whole team of 10 co-workers, not only did he accommodate all of us, but somehow despite ordering a wide variety of dishes and spice levels, every single one of use left extremely satisfied with our meal and experience.

I highly recommend the cashew curry dishes - a perfect combination of umami and spice!
PS: yes, I just had to take a bite out of my food before the picture, it smelled THAT good.
author: Adrian G.

description:
Overall pretty good spot.

- Owner and staff was very friendly and attentive. 
- Food was flavorful with spices, meat quality was good. But too salty for our party's taste, I ate all my rice and naan. :)
author: Sherman H.

description:
I got the #12. Nagala Sya - Traditional Chicken Curry
Combo ($16.99) and a butter naan ($2.99). I could not believe how little food you get. I figured this would be enough for 2 people but maybe we're too hungry? It just seemed like so little for what you pay. 

The Nagala Sya is spicy, but really good. As aforementioned, just wish we got more food. It's $14.99 without the rice and definitely not worth it.

Other than that, the delivery person was very courteous and we got the food quickly. That definitely gets them a star.
author: Ximena C.

description:
This hole-in-the-wall serves fresh, light, savory and home-cooked Nepalese dishes. It's a real gem.

We started with the vegetable momos ($7 for six) which tasted great, with a savory filling. The rice wrapper could have been tighter and less doughy, but it was still fine overall (the best momos in the Bay Area can be found at Urban Momo in San Jose, fyi).

The menu has a bunch of vegetarian dishes, most of which are vegan by default (with the exception of the ones with paneer or egg).

The rayo saag tarkari ($13) consists of delicately cooked mustard greens in a light savory sauce. Get this dish.

The kwanti daal ($13) comes filled with kidney beans, black lentils and green onion, making this dish seem almost like Nepalese chili, but so much more complex and better. I loved this.

Lastly the aloo tama bodi ($13) has lightly cooked black eyed beans with potato and bamboo. It's a great mixture of crunchy and soft, starchy and moist, salty and tangy. What a great dish.

All of the a la carte dishes come with brown rice and butter naan; unfortunately, Cuisine of Nepal doesn't have a vegan bread option such as roti or chapati (naan is almost always made with yogurt kneaded into the dough).

The service was okay, but not great. 

All in all, Cuisine of Nepal makes some wonderful food and is worth repeat visits.
author: Kedar D.

description:
I cannot get enough of this place. First of all, the owner And head chef Prem is one of the nicest hosts you can get in SF.
He welcomes everyone and offers complimentary tea or wine if you are waiting in line for a table.

Then, the food is amazing. Their Curry's are a must try, my favorite being the cashew chicken. 

Then all their kabobs are very yummy

Lastly their sizzling platters are a perfect mix of you want to get something other than curry.

As appetizers, I would recommend the samosas
author: Jad A.

description: This place is delicious and the service is just as good!Fair warning: this is a bias review because I got to meet the chef of the establishment and he gave my table a free bottle of wine. Get the cashew chicken curry! Seriously though, the highlight for me has to be that my friends and I got to meet the chef here who was beyond sweet. Will certainly come back!
author: Emily G.

description: Enormous portions and delicious food. The lamb was incredible.
author: Emily M.

description: Prem (the owner) is the best - best...both as a chef and human.  Not only is the food amazing, he does so much to support his community, both in the Bay Area and Nepal.  If you haven't eaten here yet you must try it!  And take his recommendation - eat with your hands!!!
author: George M.

description:
Great food; the owner/ chef is very friendly and tries to accommodate guests even if they are overbooked 

The food can be very spicy but can be made milder upon request. The portions are generous but not huge and given how reasonably priced everything is it's easy to over order and have lots of delicious leftovers for the next day ++
author: David S.

description:
Two friends and I had a late Thursday night dinner (9pm), and the restaurant was not too crowded by then. That being said, parking in the area was still a bit of a struggle.

Nonetheless, the meal was worth it. Our waiter and waitress were really nice and attentive. The menu isn't too big, but there are some awesome options for meat eaters and vegetarians alike. We started with pork momo, which had an awesome sauce. The skin was a bit doughier than other momo I've had, but I still loved the taste. As my main, I got the lamb basil curry; the a la carte option includes a good amount of food and includes naan and rice. The basil really came through and was abundant throughout the dish. The lamb kabob was good, maybe a teeny bit dry, but I loved the seasoning on the outside.

Definitely worth checking out if you want a wholesome, delicious food adventure.
author: Jess L.

description:
Situation
- Dinner with a friend on a Thursday
- Ordered the Samosa's and a Chicken dish
Pros
- The food items I ordered were very delicious
- The Chicken was cooked perfectly
- Even the leftovers tasted great the next day
- The service was excellent and friendly
author: Dipesh G.

description:
Cashew Chicken - mild. 

Order that and you will be so happy. 

The other things I ordered to try were ok. I'm talking about you pumpkin curry and those dumpling things. The desserts are also not that memorable so save your calories and cash. 

The cashew chicken, mild, with rice. 

Do it and be happy. 

Pro-tip: dinner comes with their lovely lentil soup so don't do what I did and order the bean curry. It's the same thing - just a larger portion. 

Fiver for that cashew chicken dish alone. 

I wanted to lick my plate. Ok fine, I licked my plate. 

Get it. Seriously.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Ordered delivery and this was the BEST INDIAN/NEPALI FOOD I've had in a long time! Trust the high reviews-food is flavorful and fresh. Really reasonably priced and HUGE portions as well. 

I ordered the salmon grill with peppers and onions and salmon was cooked perfectly. Came with brown rice and naan. I also got the veggie samosas which were stuffed with peas and potatoes and spices. Would highly recommend!

I prefer to cook for myself but in a pinch it's nice to have a go-to take out or delivery place that's high quality. Cuisine of Nepal is going to be that place for me--so so good!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Parking is in this location is a major pain. I dropped off my friends and it took me 15 more mts to find a spot...life in the city.

It was worth it though! For the uninitiated...Nepali food is a mixture of Indian and Asian but has it's own unique dishes too. The setup of the restaurant is quaint, will make for a good date spot.  They were not busy on a Wed evening which was nice. 

We had the momo which is Nepali version of dumplings which was  excellent. The saag paneer and pharsi which is a Nepalo butternut curry were both delicious too. The food was healthy, felt like home cooked and not too oily. Prem who is the owner/chef is a great host as well. Very talented and a good soul.
author: Sunil R.

description: Wow. Yum. This is some rock solid food.  the curry with the sunde chicken was stellar!
author: Mark B.

description:
Amazing! Amazing! 

The cashew chicken curry reminds me a lot of like a chicken tikka masala but instead of like a tomato base almost reminds me of something with like a creamy curry flavor. 

They service is great and the food comes fast. Given the portion size, the price is reasonable.

The lentils and spicy sauce that comes with the entrees are also a nice touch. It would be easy to share food here. The naan is also good.

I checked in on yelp and got a free glass of wine and he let us choose between red or white. Wine was good and went along with our meal well. My husband doesn't eat cilantro and they were happy to accommodate him on the sizzling chicken dish. There was no cilantro on the cashew curry.

We are excited about the idea of coming back to this local neighborhood gem. Absolutely fantastic!!!
author: Alyssa A.

description:
An excellent choice for exciting food. A fantastic deal. Get the Bhojan set meals. Choose a plain meat like cubed lamb.

The owner is very friendly and accommodating. Treats the staff well, welcoming to walk ins, keeps everything clean and fast.

I've eaten here now dozens of times. You will too.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Food = good.  First time having Himalayan/Nepalese cuisine. Flavorful and spicy but without the heartburn. 

Chhoila - Cubed BBQ lamb. Friend liked it.  Her order and I'm not a lamb fan so didn't try it. $7.99

Palak Paneer = great. $15.99 (combo)

Momo - Chicken = delicious and they're quite large in size. $6.99

Aloo tama bodi = delicious. He loved the blackeyed peas.  $12.99 

Bhanta tarkari = smoky and spicy.  $14.99

Service = efficient. We did take out though.

Prices = moderate. $63.96.
author: Fannie S.

description:
This place was awesome!  Nice and snug atmosphere with bigger tables in the rear.  Food tasted really good, I ordered salmon sizzling plate, perfectly seasoned and really juicy.  I don't know how they cook it with char and juice at the same time.  Chicken cashew curry was delicious, such a unique flavor in a curry.  Spiciness levels were predictable.  Hot level was right on the border of enjoyable and painful...just the way I like it.

 Owner, Prem, came to our table to greet us and make sure we were doing fine.  Great place, would recommend!
author: Alex T.

description:
Probably one of my new favorite places due to its uniqueness (how often do you find a Nepal restaurant?) customer service (one of the best) and affordability. 

PARKING:
Just to start it off, this restaurant is small, so I highly recommended making a reservation for larger parties (which is easy to do so via the Yelp app). Parking can be very difficult during the night time, so be prepared to account for that when traveling to this place.

SERVICE:
The service here is for sure one of the best I ever had. The owner consistently came back to update us on our wait and after waiting for only 10 minutes, the owner offered us a free glass of wine (white or red) just while we wait for our table. For those who can get seated immediately, you can always check in through the Yelp app for your free glass :) In addition, to help decrease our wait time, he even took our orders before we got seated, just so the food came out quicker. Service throughout the night was still flawless and it was great to see how hardworking and passionate the owner and everyone else was here! 

ATMOSPHERE: 
The decoration was very homey feeling and overall clean. There is also a small bar towards the back of the restaurant, where people just hang around and talk. Although very small place, the whole place had a "home" and chill feeling all around.

FOOD:
The best part of the night. For food, we got the samosas (lamb), sizzling pawn platter and the curry basil lamb. The owner had no problem suggesting and helping us order food, especially since we never tried Nepal cuisine before. For those who also never, the best way for me to describe it is a mix of Indian and Merterrian food -- since they have a combination of curry plates and plates with yogurt sauce. Samosas were hugeee and stuffed with minced lamb. Paired great with the sauce it came with and recommended for anyone who loves samosas. Sizzling pawn platter came hot, both in terms of temperature and spicy level. Would recommend to anybody who loves spicy food! Lastly, the curry lamb was probably my favorite dish of the night. Flavorful and tasted great with the butter naan that came with the dish!

 TLDR: Great food! Best customer service I had in a long time, and I would highly recommend to anyone who wants to try something different  at an affordable rate!
author: Jenny N.

description:
This was a miss. We ordered delivery after a long travel day, excited to get Nepalese food but what we got just simply wasn't very tasty. 

We got the Palak Paneer; basically spinach, curry and cheese and it was not good. The cheese was squeaky -- it literally made a weird squeaky sound as you ate it and the sauce was watery and under spiced.

The vegetable momos were the highlight for sure and the dipping sauce was good. The naan was chewy and super flat, and a blind taste test of the basically unflavored garlic vs plain would stump anyone. 

The delivery option was for basmati or brown rice and went with basmati.. instead got cheap white rice like you'd find at a Panda Express or food court Chinese spot.

Oh and they didn't pack utensils or napkins which is a bummer since we're in a hotel and had to go looking for some. Would totally skip this spot.
author: Adam S.

description:
What a great way to spend my last weekend at Cuisine of Nepal; perfect for the cold weather before spring is here.  There's nothing better than to try Nepalese food which is quite similar to Indian food.  I once checked its menu and its narrow dining area before I come inside on my next visit.  Looks cute and enchanting.  Walk-ins are acceptable since I was the first customer to come inside and choose the last seating of the narrow dining area near where I can easily smell the aroma of the spices.  Its background music was relaxing except the first song contains catchy lyrics in a broken record.  I'm glad the first song has ended before I hear the next relaxing music.  On to the food and drink selection!

I choose masala chai as a hot tea without Himalayan milk, but why whole milk as a Himalayan milk?  Anyways, I put in two packets of sugar in the raw to sweetened up the plain masala chai.

For my appetizer, a bowl of Jhol with my choice of lentils (I never expected a bigger bowl).  I admit, I should've chosen the Himalayan Momo which is a traditional appetizer, but a Bengali soup was a much better choice.  I be ready to bring out plenty of napkins if I need to wipe away my sweat.  After a few spoonfuls, I easily break a sweat and I need to wipe my forehead right away.

For my main course, a dish of Kwanti Daal, comes with Basmati Rice and four quarter pieces of crispy naan bread.  Kidney beans, black eyed peas, and lentils are truly plant based for consumption.  After a couple spoonful of Himalayan "chili", its spices were more intense than Jhol.  I again wiped away my sweat and blow my nose.  I took a spoonful of plain Basmati Rice as a way to ease down the spices.

After finishing up the meal (except the naan bread), I finished Raita last.  By choosing medium spice, I managed to make it through til the early afternoon.  And honestly, its spices are real compared to Viva Goa.  I'm glad to try something new which is worth the experience.  Customer service was very promising.  Even though few customers came, it never take long for every food and drink to come to my table.
author: Jimmy C.

description: I love this restaurant .. I have been coming here for a couple years now . Super friendly staff , and great food ! Free glass of wine w a yelp check in too !
author: Micah W.

description:
The food is cooked by heart and soul. I love Nepal, people and food so I looked for a Nepali restaurant. Very fortunate I found cuisine of Nepal. 

The first impression was the chef and the boss came to greet and arrange the waiting list at the entrance by himself. He was nice, gentle and kind offering complementary drink like tea, wine by himself although the line was not long waiting. 

The plates we ordered' lamb curry was so delicious, my favorite was dal soup, mixed of chicken, fish, lamb on sizzling plate was also flavorful.
author: Pat R.

description:
Slowly working my way through the menu and have yet to find anything I haven't enjoyed. They are not fooling with their spicy levels. I have dabbled with medium but pretty much stay with mild.
Always yummy. Always reasonably priced. Always delivered quickly.
author: Andrew Y.

description: One of the best restaurant in town great service,quality of food . Wow I am so impressed.
author: Somnath R.

description:
This restaurant is such a gem!

My wife and I decided to try some new food and we went to Cuisine of Nepal and had an amazing time because:
- the staff are so welcoming and obliging. The owner was there and checked on us a number of times too.
- the different foods are delicious but the chicken cashew cream curry was so good I nearly cried!!!
- portions are really big and we ended up taking some amazing food home

We're definitely coming back for some more amazing food and also to support the lovely people running this restaurant. It surely deserves all the good ratings and we were really happy to see it prosper and being packed full when we were leaving.
author: Les E.

description:
Very nice family owned restaurant. 

Huge portions and delicious down to earth food. It's not a light meal but certainly isn't overly greasy or heavy either.
author: Danielle A.

description: Hidden Gem!!! Too bad I don't live in San Francisco, if I dod, it would definitely be one of my regular places to eat. The steamed dumplings and  traditional lamb curry is amazing.  The Lamb can be cut with the spoon. I felt their knife.  Dull and not serrated but why would you need one with meat THAT tender?!? The chicken cashew curry is rich and tastes great. The owner went around and asked if we needed anything and is very humble. My first time and unfortunately not sure when my next visit will be since I'm heading back to Los Angeles.
author: Chi Huy C.

description:
Absolutely love this mom and pop vibing place! Service was very attentive and the food is delicious! As everyone on here has already mentioned, GET THE MOMOS AND CASHEW CHICKEN! Tho momos are a bit different from what I've had before - the filling has some curry in it which adds to the flavor.

The cashew chicken literally melts in your mouth and is extremely addicting. A combo comes with naan, rice, and some small stews.
author: Dee Dee T.

description:
Had a really nice meal here. 

The service is excellent and everyone liked their food. I got the sizzling chicken platter and asked for it extra spicy but it was still pretty mild. Also got the samosas and really enjoyed them.

Good value for the portion - brought home some leftovers for lunch the next day. 

It does seem to get pretty crowded. 

I would definitely come back here!
author: Emma B.

description:
very average
it just wasnt very good foood but it was okay
author: Charles D.

description: I was in the city for work and was trying to find a restaurant near my next stop. I was able to find street parking around the restaurant and there was no wait to get seated. The waitress told me the most popular dishes and helped me pick between two curry dishes - the Kukhurako ledo that she said is similar to a tikka masala or a basil lamb curry. She said for my first time, I should go with the Kukhurako ledo, which is a chicken cashew creamy curry. I paired it with an Anna Ra Dahi, which is a mango shake (very similar to a mango lassi). The drink was very refreshing, if you like a creamier and less icy mango smoothie, this is the perfect drink! The curry was so delicious, the meat was tender, the curry was very creamy, and it comes with butter naan and basmati white rice. I got the al a carte which is perfect for one person, I had some leftovers that I can snack on later. I highly recommend this place if you want a delicious, Nepalese meal- the ambiance of the restaurant is really relaxing too!
author: Anna B.

description: This is honestly the best restaurant I've been to in some time in San Francisco. The food was delicious and the overall dining experience was out of this world.
author: Jack C.

description: I am shocked by the 5 star reviews. I asked for not spicy for every dish, but everything we got was spicy so I could barely eat it. The mango shakes could hardly be called shakes, it was super thin and syrup-y and not very tasty. They also did not arrive with our order (I had to call and they sounded sweet on the phone and did send some right away but still). The food was OK on taste but tiny quantity for the cost, could barely feed one human per dish and that's with getting the Combo meals! The so called vegetables that came with the Combo dishes were submerged in liquid, more like a watery bland stew. The only thing I enjoyed in this meal was the naan. If it was just me I would not have bothered with a bad review but we had guests over and ordered for everyone and I was bummed to not be able to feed them something better. I am sorry to say I am never ordering from this place again.
author: She F.

description:
I just did Yelp's Eat 24 delivery from here.  It was definitely one of the better options.  Unfortunately, I only got appetizers and desserts, but I'll definitely have to go back for the cashew chicken!  I ended up ordering the momo dumplings, samosas, and the lal mohan.  

Himalayan Momo:
Fantastic.  Really hit the spot and had that perfect amount of spice and flavor.  The sauce was very flavorful as well.  This was without a doubt, my favorite thing here.

Samosas:
While I'm not the biggest fan of these, I still ended up trying it.  They were much better than other ones I've had in the past.  The shell had a nice flavor that wasn't simply just a wrapper.  The filling was great too.

Lal Mohan (gulab jamun):
Pretty good, not overly sweet.  There were 3 in the order for about $4.  I always love these, but personally, I would share them as it is a lot of sweet goodness.  

Like I said, I'll definitely have to see the actual restaurant itself.  The food is fantastic and definitely worth a visit or delivery order!
author: Bryson L.

description:
We came here with a group of coworkers as part of an employee resource group...best part was that the company paid, however, the food would have been just as good if it was not free.

We ended up ordering family style as we were part of a 15 person group. The staff there were super friendly. If you check in on Yelp they give you a free glass of house wine. About half of our table started checking in and the guy told us not to worry, the whole table can get a glass of wine and save our check in glass for the next time we visit...awesome!

We had the lamb, chicken, shrimp, and eggplant.  I loved all of it except the eggplant BUT that is not the fault of the restaurant, but it is just not a fav of mine.  The combos all come with rice, naan, and some sauce sides that were all amazing.

I would recommend coming here and trying anything they recommend!
author: Danielle B.

description: We had a wonderful dining and eating experience! The chef himself made his recommendations to our table based on our requests, and we were not disappointed! If I lived here I would frequent this place.
author: Cassy F.

description: 1st time being there and since Ive never had Nepal food a asked the waitress to recommend a dish. I had the Spinach chicken curry with brown rice. It was delicious. I can't wait to come back and have momos and their chicken kebabs. It smells really yummy inside the restaurant.
author: Dalia C.

description:
Wow, wow , wow..
This place is incredible, was out in SF visiting my bf and we both absolutely love the chicken curry plate, every bite is flavorful and the garlic Nani is excellent. Third time here and I will definitely be coming back
author: Diana B.

description: Delicious. Charming staff & service. A new neighborhood gem.
author: Kimbro B.

description:
Wow.  #11 w Dahl and chicken Momos for the win.
 We couldn't stop eating.  The owner was so friendly and helpful.  We have visited Nepal over 10 years ago and this brought us back.
author: Tracee C.

description:
Although I've only ordered delivery from here, it has never disappointed. After long work days, I will place an order of my go-to Palak Paneer Curry combo meal at around 9pm and eagerly await for it to arrive within the hour. The curry always has the perfect flavoring and spice level, and the naan will melt in your mouth. The combo sides are also tasty treats, especially the lentils which taste like the comfort one needs after a stressful work day. I cannot recommend the combo meal enough!

And the best part? I can generally make 2-3 meals out of the single order (#LoveLeftovers). 

PS: The (only) downside? They're closed on Mondays, so plan your stomach schedule accordingly.
author: Ruth R.

description:
This is a cute little restaurant at the intersection of Cortland and Mission. The owner is extremely friendly always welcoming us with a smile and knows a lot of regulars by name. The chicken choila, momos and samosa are excellent. I liked the noodles too but it was a tad oily.

I have to go back try some other items on the menu ! Can get crowded on weekend nights but they have a good vibe going and its ok to wait for a little bit.
author: Anju J.

description: Absolutely love how the flavors unfold one after another in their roasted meat as well as curry bases. Savory supreme! The combo is a great value in terms of price/portion size and is sure to leave you feeling full. Bonus points for their Masala Chai with Himalayan Milk! Its an excellent mix of spice along with sweetness from the milk.
author: Ronnie T.

description: The butter was really tasty love the tandoori chick the paneer was a little different then what I'm used to it was just ok the rice was cooked to perfect and the garlic WOW for delivery great value and food!
author: Frederick S.

description:
Awesomeeeeeeee! Everything is awesome! Lamb is great, cashew chicken is
Soooooo goooood!
author: Nissa G.

description: Prices are really good, with food to match. The thing that took it over the top was the friendliness of the chef/owner and the staff. The chef came out to say hello and to check on how we liked our meals; he also offered every patron some wine. The butter chicken was delicious and so was the naan.
author: Annie W.

description: Amazing place. Start with the appetizer: I would recommend having their lamb samosa and dumplings with Masala chai. It's worth it. Haven't had any lamb samosa better than this in whole San Francisco. In the entree chicken sizzler is definitely a must have. I like the staff, they all are very friendly and kind. I asked them if we can have chai instead of complimentary wine bottle. They let us do that. Note: chai is refill.
author: Sumbal A.

description: Great service and food! Samosas came in steamy and was potato and lamb. Sauces were delicious. Cashew chicken has a very delicious and unique flavor my friends and I loved it
author: Amy L.

description:
The Chef and owner Prem serves authentic Nepali cuisine. Try his Paneer Tikka Masala with brown rice, dal tadka, tomato chutney with complimentary glass of red  wine when you checkin on Yelp. 
The food is simple yet healthy. I went here with my American employer and she loved the cuisine.
author: Charuvu S.

description: Awesome restaurant. The food is authentic, and they aren't afraid to make it a bit spicy which I appreciate. Service is top notch, although they were a little overwhelmed when we last visited. They were nice enough to preemptively offer us a free bottle of wine for the delay in service! Which I thought was extremely generous.
author: Daniel B.

description: The food is fascinating and amazingly great. I would give this place 100 stars if I could. If you're around the area and don't know where to go, Cuisine of Nepal is the place to go. Excellent service and friendly staff.
author: Ayush K.

description:
Came here for a team dinner--yay!

Premium and his crew of servers did a fabulous job taking care of us.

We ordered a selection of beers, wine and appetizers. The chicken momo dumplings were better than the vegetarian version. The wrappers were on the thick side. 

Vegetable pakoda were spot on and yummy dipped in chutney. 

The choila was so good we devoured it within minutes of arrival.

Portion size of the entrees were inconsistent. The butternut squash curry, cashew chicken curry were both delicious and about the same size but my traditional chicken curry (Nagala Sya) was colossal in comparison as it had a bine in breast and bone in thigh portion. 

It did taste great and with the lentil and vegetable side combo, represented a lot of food. The basmati was steamed well, naan breads had a lovely char. 

Premium poured another glass of chardonnay for my colleague and left the bottle with him since there was a bit leftover--classy touch!

The small and long dining room fills rapidly. Come early or make reservations.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description:
Omg!! The food here is soo yummy. 
The traditional lamb & chicken curry are soo tasty and tender... like fall off the fork tender. Dumplings & naan are delish. As if the food itself isn't enough to lure you, the customer service is beyond! Owner, son & staff are super friendly. The owner greets & chats briefly with all the patrons. Made us feel as if we're home. Even my kids love the food. What a hidden gem!
author: Lena B.

description: I read the reviews for this place before we went and I was excited. We called ahead to make a reservation and were seated right away. We ordered our food with mild spice and it was just right. The chef was very attentive and came to ask us if we needed anything and how we thought everything was. However, the food was not as spectacular as I was expecting. It was good but not mind blowing. I wouldn't go back.
author: Aria K.

description: Taste and food quality is too notch. Ambience is great and service is good. We ordered palak paneer combo. Never had such tasty palak paneer before!
author: Sneha A.

description:
In here twice and i really liked the food! It has a North Indian touch and some authentic Nepalese food. 
The seating can get cramped so if you're a bigger group it might be best to reserve ahead of time. 

The chili chicken was very tasty, so was the butter chicken. The chef suggested a very spicy dish (perhaps not on the menu) and oh boy it burnt everyone's tongues!  So if you're into that Linda stuff the def ask for it. 

I think this is a good date place as well.
author: Arjan N.

description: Delicious food, friendly servers, and quick service! The server even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine!
author: Kevin L.

description: Cashew curry is simply delicious! I really enjoyed the flavorful foods here, and can't wait to come back for more. Others mentioned the smokiness of the interior and it seemed that the restaurant is not as well ventilated as it needs to be, but I wasn't bothered by it too much. Then opened the front door to vent the dining room out when it got too smokey. Wouldn't deter me as the food is so good.
author: Mei W.

description:
Be sure to try the cashew chicken.  The sauce is YES. 
Great flavors that you can dial from mild to wild at 
your request.  A subtle complex mix on the palate.  Clean and fresh. 
Not oily or overly buttered.  Generous portions of nan and mango chutney.  I had delivery.  I would order from them again.
author: Portia S.

description:
Delicious Nepali foods of all varieties those I have eaten all are great!!!! Curries of chicken, lamb vegetable were the my best and favorite with endless tests 
Top of that friendly crews service and head chef all are great also extras were over feed . I revisit time to time
You should go and try out authentic Nepali foods
author: Yan R.

description: Excited to have found a great new place to order from! I ordered the Kukhurako Sekuwa Chicken Kebab, naan, and Lal Mohan. The chicken was awesome, tender with lots of flavor. The naan was okay, not as crispy as I'd like and I probably wouldn't order the Lal Mohan again but that's just because it's better fresh than delivered. Definitely recommend.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
This place is so great! My husband and I ordered SO much food (too much, in retrospect!). The seat meal, "Bhojan party of 2," comes with an appetizer platter (steamed dumplings, empanadas, sizzling meat, and a curry) and a mango smoothie. You can choose what meat/filling you want for the set meal.

We opted for the pork dumplings, sizzling chicken, veggie empanadas, and pumpkin curry. Let's just say we were full after the appetizer platter. Everything was fantastic although the chicken was a bit on the dry side. Our favorites were the dumplings because of the amazing cumin seasoning and thick skin, but the vegetable empanadas were a close second!

Oh, and check in for a free glass of house wine. :)

Servers were super friendly, and the chef came around to check on us.

Cuisine of Nepal is a warm, low-key place to enjoy some awesome and authentic Nepalese food! We'll be back :)
author: Valerie L.

description: I ordered for delivery and food arrived before the quoted timeframe. I ordered the Kukhurako Ledo (cashew creamy chicken) that included rice and naan. It was hot and fresh and most importantly, delicious! The Kukhurako Ledo was sooooo good. It would be a total waste of a good sauce, and so I licked my plate clean. The naan was huge and plenty of rice and chicken leftover for tomorrow. I will definitely order from them again and most likely dine in the restaurant and try the other foods in addition to Kukhurako Ledo that was soooooo good!
author: Marcy B.

description: My husband and I love this place. We come here regularly and always enjoy the experience. The chef is fantastic and he and his staff are always super welcoming and remember us. The food is terrific, especially for vegetarians. I also stayed in Nepal for a summer, and while the food here is not as spicy as the food there, it's delicious and authentic. Always fresh and amazing. My favorites are the Tofu Takari and the Palak Paneer. But really, everything is wonderful.
author: Ue C.

description:
AMAZING!!! I've never had Nepalese or Himalayan before, but if you enjoy Indian cuisine you'll love it (they're very similar). To start, my dad split the pork momo (dumplings) and lamb samosas... we had been trekking around the city all day and were absolutely famished. I got the creamy cashew chicken curry (a la carte, comes with naan and rice) per Yelp recommendations and it was phenomenal. Delicious. The owner stopped by every now and then to ask us if we were enjoying everything and even brought my dad a free glass of wine:) very nice staff, wonderful experience.

My ONLY issue was the seating and spacing of tables. I didn't dock stars because of this, I understand it's a small space and it's still very nice, but the way the restaurant is set up- with tables lined up on a widencorridor- does not allow for much privacy and the sound carries. It's hard to hear each other even when restaurant has few other patrons.

It was an incredible experience and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Would highly recommend.
author: Corinne L.

description:
This place is awesome! The food was delicious, the staff were friendly and accommodating, and the night turned out perfect. It's a smaller, cozier restaurant with a great vibe.

Highly recommend the steamed dumplings to start off, and if you don't want to order another round of dumplings, the Chana Saag (Spinach, Garbanzo Curry) combo was delightful.

Will definitely be returning soon :)
author: Mak K.

description:
Cuisine of Nepal is a cozy restaurant located in Bernal Heights that serves up very homey Nepalese food. I came here with two others on a Friday night, and we were seated right away at one of the many open tables, but by the time we left, the place was completely packed. The service here was so kind and made sure to provide everything we needed, and the food was delicious as well!

Between the three of us, we decided to order and split the Bhojan (set menu) for 2, which the chef assured us was enough for three people to share (and he was definitely right). The Bhojan came with two glasses of the house wine, which unfortunately were pretty flavorless (not that we came to this restaurant for its alcohol). Our meal started with a plate of appetizers: chicken momos, the cubed flame-roasted chicken, and the potato samosas. These came with three different dipping sauces: a spicy tomato sauce, a sweet and savory brown sauce, and a mint chutney. I found the chicken momos a little bit underwhelming (relatively bland), but the cubed chicken had so much great flavor from the chiles it was cooked with, and the spiced potato mixture in the samosas was so fragrant and delicious. Each of the three of the sauces added great flavor to the food as well!

Then came the main entree. First, we were given two large platters that came with some staples: rice, naan, a vegetable soup, and a lentil soup. The naan was much chewier than other naan breads I've had, and both of the soups were well-spiced and tasty. The two entrees that came with the Bhojan were the sizzling chicken platter, which came with chunks of chicken that had a strange rubbery texture (though not overcooked/dry), which wasn't quite to my liking, and a black-eyed pea/bamboo shoot curry, which had a really unique texture and went very well with the naan bread (though I'd prefer a little bit more spice/flavor in a curry).

Overall, this was a great restaurant with very authentic, home-style Nepalese food. While some of the dishes weren't the best in my opinion, the service was definitely on point, and this meal made for a great cultural experience. My only complaint was that the restaurant was quite warm/stuffy inside, which made me sweat quite a lot while eating the spicy food. However, that definitely didn't deter me from going back for more!
author: David K.

description: Yum! I usually get delivery from here which I always enjoy. It always comes within 30 minutes of ordering- palak paneer, Kukhura Ko Ledo a La Carte, and naan- I mean the perfect order of comfort food. When I did go here to dine in the restaurant the owner greeted us and profusely apologized for making us wait for our table- he gave us free wine while we were waiting. Overall a great neighborhood staple that I frequent quite a bit.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Amazing food. 

Located in an unassuming spot in Bernal Heights, it was pretty out of the way to get to from across the city. Over an hour Muni ride actually (with some delays). By the time we arrived, my boyfriend and I were borderline hangry. 

We immediately ordered the Himalayan Momos with pork. They're kind of like any steamed pork dumplings you've probably had many times if you're familiar with Asian food, except the filling was heavily spiced with what I think might have been curry powder and cumin. And instead of vinegar or soy sauce, they were served with tomato sauce. Really good, but the real highlight were the entrees!

We picked the Chicken Cashew Cream Curry combo, and the Palak Paneer Curry combo. You can order your entrée a la carte, which comes with butter naan & white or brown rice (no extra charge for brown!), but like I said, we were hungry. So we ordered the combos, which come with lentils, mixed vegetables, tomato chutney, butter naan, & white or brown rice. 

BEST curries I've ever had, for real. The chicken cashew cream curry was so amazingly flavorful, I really could have licked the bowl clean. The palak paneer was great too. I liked that you could really see and taste the fresh spinach in the curry, and the paneer tasted fresh too!

Love, love, love. Would absolutely come back.
author: Sara L.

description: Absolutley amazing!!!! My taste buds had an orgasm!!!!!!! Beautiful beautiful Beautiful!!!! Service was over the top!!!! Don't think twice!!! Come visit!!
author: Paty O.

description:
Absolutely love love love this place! Knew that this place opened last year in Bernal Heights but still hadn't got a chance to try it out until yesterday.

Usually I'm not that huge of a fan of Nepal cuisine, but this place completely changed my attitude towards it, and made me want to try more of it in the future. I ordered the deep fried vegetables to start. The plate came with two different sauces: one sweet and sour sauce and one green sauce. The green sauce with deep fried vegetables definitely offered a very interesting taste and my friend and I both loved it. 

For the entree, I got the basil lamb curry a la carte. Haven't seen a lot of reviews of the lamb on Yelp, so I decided to give it a try. It is definitely one of the underrated dishes here at Cuisine of Nepal. The lamb tasted really good. I think I got the mild option and it was the default option when you order. I would recommend this option to beginner curry-eaters. 

This place didn't disappoint me at all. The service was phenomenal - the owner was constantly smiling and checking in with us to see whether if there was anything that he could do. Although we made a reservation, there was no line on a Tuesday night. Expect to spend around $20 here.
author: Jack T.

description:
Eaten here twice so far, once in the restaurant and one delivery. Both times it's been amazing! 

I'm vegetarian and their dishes have a lot of flavor and depth and none of the meat flavors that I'm not so excited when I taste in my veggie dishes. 

They keep it real and are super friendly! 

We'll be back soon :)
author: Joh O.

description:
Not only is this restaurant one of my favorites in the city... the owner is so sweet! You MUST get the chicken Momo when you go!

I wish they delivered to the Sunset for the times I can't make it into the restaurant!
author: Annie O.

description: Small and hidden restaurant, but delicious flavors...we enjoyed the food so much! The service was also good, very friendly and attentive. I enjoyed La Crema wine with my meal, they have a decent wine selection. I LOVE all the curries, particularly the chicken cashew, potato cauliflower and palak paneer. The meat combo was also delicious, lamb and chicken were very tender and flavorful. Naan bread was delicious as were the lentil side dishes. Can get a little smoky and hot by the kitchen. Better ventilation would be helpful. We have been back several times because we enjoy the food so much. Street parking is also decent in this area.
author: L T.

description: Best Nepalese in SF. Owner is amazing and so nice. Super cozy environment and great for dates.
author: SS J.

description: This place is amazing. The customer service is incredibly friendly and accommodating, you can tell it's a passion project of the delightful owner. I live in the neighborhood and ordered takeout, when I arrived my name was spelled wrong on the order so the owner gave me free bottle of wine to take home ‍...I got the pumpkin curry, it was absolutely delicious. This will be one of my new favorite neighborhood spots.
author: Ellie H.

description:
This place got rave reviews so I had to give it a try.   Came here with four other friends last night.   

I had made a reservation a few weeks ago.   Unfortunately had hit some traffic so I called ahead to tell them we were running 10-15 min late but the person answering the phone gave me attitude saying there were people waiting outside.  You're welcome got giving a courtesy call?!  Jeez. 

When we arrived, service was spotty and slow, we had five people and they gave us four settings and not enough water or cups etc.   

I had asked the chef for recommendations and he put me on hold.  

Finally we just made the executive decision of what to order. 

Break down: the Cashew chicken was the best, followed by the ribs and momo.   We ordered grilled chicken but it was super dry and flavorless.   

Momo tasted like a curry dumpling, very different than other momo. 

Overall I think the food here was good but not the best Nepalese I've had (coming from NY).
author: Kimberly L.

description:
My favorite thing about this place, hospitality. The way you are treated here makes you feel like you're visiting an uncle's place. The owner is constantly around trying to make sure you are happy. He is the bus boy, waiter, cook, everything. 

We got the 2 person special. That comes with A LOT OF FOOD. A LOT OF FOOD. A LOT OF FOOD. Starts with momo's (dumplings), samosa, bbq lamb, sizzling chicken.

Momos were not like your chinese dumplings. They were less juicy as much as just filling. Samosa was pretty good. The bbq lamb had this horseradish flavor that was very unexpected. You also get a special plate of goodies, which will include rice, naan, curry. The last sizzling chicken was pretty standard IMO.

I don't think the food is what makes this place special, but the hospitality. I think this is unique to a place in SF and makes it very special.
author: Victor D.

description:
Food is tasty. Service is friendly. Chef Prem takes his time to say hello to guest. 
Even though my cousins are half Nepalese I haven't had much experience with its cuisine.  I'm in love with kukhuraku ledo and  momo, can't wait to try the other dishes and to visit
author: Naty D.

description: One of my favorite places in San Francisco. Delicious Nepalese food with outstanding hospitality from Prem. I cannot compliment Prem more for his kindness and the freshness of all the food. I have come here twice and each time been blown away by the food. It, unlike most Indian restaurants, uses minimal oil/cream and almost no butter, and ends up leaving you so full of joy. Truly the best. Prem even gave me a free birthday chalice!
author: Harshith A.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE. I take all my friends here when they visit me in Bernal Heights. The chicken cashew curry is magical.
author: Angela O.

description:
Momo. Order of six, half chicken half veggie. Comes with a spicy dipping sauce. We liked the veggie best

Lamb platter, comes on sizzling plate with onions.  And the sides are lentils and a potato and carrot dish, naan, and white rice 

Chicken cashew curry. Comes with naan and white rice

Service is very nice. And gave our table free glasses of wine

Took the J muni from Randall and easy walk here
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Tasty flavorful vegan and meat choices 
Friendly and cozy environment 
Authentic and thoughtful selection of foods 
Polite, helpful, cheerful staff
Seems like a family owned and operated restaurant.
author: L H.

description: We traveled from the East Coast and chose this restaurant for dinner on a Sunday night. The service was quick, the restaurant  small and the food was tasty. Only downside is one loud talker turns the dining room into an echo chamber. On the plus side, I now know more about molecular biology. Good prices. Good food. Nothing extraordinary.
author: Zak M.

description:
My wife and I came to Cusine of Nepal for lunch yesterday and it left such an impression on my wife that this morning she told me she wishes she had more momos and the sauce that came with it. It was all around a good experience eating here.

When we first walked in we were greeted by Prem, the owner and chef. He is extremely friendly and hospitable. I wanted to try a nice variety of the food so I ordered the combo menu for two. 

The meal included two glasses of wine, momos, cubed lamb, potato samosas, chicken curry, sizzling chicken, along with rice and naan. I grouped everything together because all the food was delicious, not to be overlooked is the naan which was soft as buttery. 

I would not hesitate to come back and look forward to the next time I can come to Cusine of Nepal restaurant. It's now one of my favorite restaurants in the city.
author: Michael L.

description:
This place is wonderful. It was a cold rainy night and I was feeling sick. Enter Cuisine of Nepal -- some of the best delivery I've ever had in Sf. 

I got the palak paneer and chicken cashew curry to split. Everything came wonderfully packaged, piping hope and wonderfully bright and fresh tasting. Portion sizes are massive and the combos are fantastic deals. 

Going to have to go in person, can't rave enough!
author: Alexandra K.

description:
For some reason, I've been riding the Nepali Express lately. No, it's not a clickety-clack train through the Himalayas. It's an exotic culinary journey that makes two stops in the East Bay (Annapurna in Oakland and Mount Everest in Berkeley) and a final stop here over the course of a month. OK, I just made that up, but that's still a lot of momos in a condensed amount of time, don't you think? Advance praise on this compact place has been overwhelmingly favorable, and in one of those rare instances when the reality matches the hype, the food here is excellent. The ambiance and staff certainly make it feel authentic, but what do I know?

The cynic in me was wondering if they hired the elder woman in the native costume as a prop (photo: http://bit.ly/2dfKbnY), but no, she was real and so was the food. The true litmus test came with the $6.99 Himalayan Momos, the indigenous steamed dumplings that I have favored since my own trip to Nepal seventeen years earlier. A half-dozen plump ones came my way stuffed with minced pork and shredded cabbage and accompanied by a unique sesame, chili and tomato chutney sauce that I didn't have at the other two spots (photo: http://bit.ly/2czFm4J). They passed my test with flying colors.

Picking a main was no easy task as there were tantalizing variations on curry. From Atlantic salmon fillet to radish ginger chicken, their palette was bursting with flavors. I chose the $15.99 Chicken Cashew Cream Curry (Kukhuraku Ledo) a la carte. The chicken was clay oven flame-roasted and diced into big chunks and bathed in a lightly blended cashew cream sauce that was like ambrosia (photo: http://bit.ly/2cMmZN4). It came with a hefty portion of butter naan and basmati white rice (photo: http://bit.ly/2cDVHYa). It was awfully quiet when I dined here on a Saturday afternoon, so hopefully the five-star reviews will draw in business despite its relatively isolated location on Mission. All aboard for the Nepali Express!

FOOD - 5 stars...luxuriant curries and grade-A momos put this Nepalese spot above the rest
AMBIANCE - 4.5 stars...native decor is not too overwhelming here though quite authentic
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...quite attentive
TOTAL - 5 stars...hopefully not the last call for this Nepali Express!
author: Ed U.

description:
Spectacular food and service. The chef himself came out multiple times to ask us how we were doing and to let him know if there was anything he could do for us!
After tasting the delicious cuisine, he had already done everything we could have asked for!!

DEFINITELY GET THE CASHEW CREAM CHICKEN CURRY AND THE MOMO CHICKEN DUMPLINGS!!!! You'll be BLOWN AWAY by the flavor. Seriously. The warm buttery naan that comes with the curry is the perfect complement to the cashew cream and is just sublime. I will definitely go back (alone, sorry fiancé) just for those two things.
author: Mio W.

description:
Butternut Squash Curry - 5 stars
So delicious and not heavy at all. Loved the spices and flavor in this dish. The butternut squash was actually a perfect complement to the curry. I also appreciate that they gave big chunks of the squash, so it wouldn't fall apart too easily.

Vegetarian Momo - 5 stars
Imagine a Chinese dumpling. Now imagine a samosa. When they marry, comes the prodigy child Momo (Himalayan dumplings). The filling was like a samosa, spicy and with a bit of potatoes. The outer layer is like a dumpling: hand-knead dough with a perfect thickness. The dip (sesame paste) is also a great combination of East Asian flavors. Delicious!

Kheer - 2 stars
They served us their kheer (rice pudding) hot, which wasn't too big of a problem for me. I think it reminds me of 八寶粥 (Chinese version of hot sweet rice soup). But - the kheer was soooo rich with fat (cream and butter probably) that it actually coated my entire palate with unpleasant gritty pieces of fat. We had a few small bites that were good, but just couldn't have any more than that. We even brought it home and added lots of nonfat milk to it and still couldn't save the dessert :( 

Overall - a really great neighborhood gem that we will definitely visit again. Also got attentive service and a warm welcome even though we sat so far out next to the door. Highly recommend their butternut squash curry and momo! Next time I'm coming for their other vegetarian curries and mayyyybe a kebab :)

Pro-tip: This place doesn't have great ventilation. My entire outfit stank of smoke after walking out. :P Wear something that you can toss in the laundry immediately after.

Pro-tip 2: Check in for a free glass of wine!! (valid as of 4/1/17). Or - if you're not drinking that day, ask them to substitute the wine with their mango lassi. I usually don't like lassi's because they're too sweet, but Cuisine of Nepal makes a 5-star lassi :)
author: Maggie G.

description:
BAM!!! Goes the flavor... Great hidden gem amongst a rather unimpressive street. The front doesn't look like it will be anything special. But, man-o-man, there are some great flavors to be had here. The restaurant is truly 'shotgun' style. Very narrow, with tables along one side the entire length. The back end opens up to more tables for larger parties. 
The food: We were here for lunch, and had the combo meals.
Bheda La Sya · Traditional Lamb Curry (Combo). Boneless Lamb cooked in curry base. 
Kukhurako Ledo · Chicken Cashew Cream Curry (Combo). Flame-broiled chicken cooked with a light blended cashew cream sauce in curry base.
The combo meals come with spicy cooked vegetables, and a wonderful lentil soup, and Naan.
The flavors are such a wonderful surprise in both of these dishes. The chicken and the lamb each were cooked to perfection, melt in your mouth. Some may think the flavors just a tad too spicy. . . But as for me... bring it on!   I love it. Just wish they were closer to my home. I would be here often.
author: Greg S.

description: Came here with a friend who lived in nepal for four months. There was no wait and the staff which is basically a family of three sat us down right away and were super sweet. They were really kind to my friend and tried to teach her more nepali over the course of the meal! We shared samosas, an eggplant curry  and a chick pea currry. We got the meal special which came with lentil soup and rice and bread. It was so filling and rich. It was perfect for a cold night. We went home happy with a lot of left overs for the week. Check this place out! It is a great value for money and has a fantastic veggie selection.
author: Anne S.

description:
This is my favorite Nepalese restaurant in the country. The owner and Cuisine of Nepal team is incredible. 

Everything here is so incredibly. I especially recommend getting the following:
- chicken momo dumplings: I've never had dumplings like this before. They tasted homemade and my family makes dumplings all the time. The dipping sauce is also incredible. 
- chicken cashew cream curr: I've never had anything like this before. Every bite dipped in this sauce was incredible.
- garlic naan: Hands down my favorite naan ever. If you like garlic, you will love this garlic coated naan.
- chicken kebab - So normally when I go out to eat and I order meat, I never order chicken. Chicken is often overcooked and too dry for my liking but oh my god, this restaurant really knows how to cook their chicken so that it's incredibly tender. This chicken is better than the chicken at Zuni Cafe because the chicken kebabs here are consistent where as the chicken at Zuni Cafe is sometimes good and sometimes too dry.

I will be back soon to recommend for dishes!
author: Jackie W.

description:
This neighborhood gem in Bernal Heights is the reason I love Yelp. It's so small and discreet that I would've never discovered it on my own. We celebrated one of my roommates' birthday here on a week night, and there were just a few families dining in. I mentioned to the owner that we were celebrating, because you never know what freebies you might get, and he definitely hooked us up.

We started with the pork momos as an appetizer. Our server told me that the sauce on the side is "not spicy," but after just a little taste, my entire mouth was on fire, so I stopped using it. I don't get the hype about momos, because without the sauce, they're just regular dumplings...with a cutesy name. The frozen dumplings I eat at home are just fine, so I wouldn't order these again. 

The 3 of us each got the chicken cashew cream curry. I know, I know. It's blasphemous for everyone at the table to order the same dish instead of hedging our bets and diversifying, but we all just REALLY wanted it. A lot of it. Thankfully, it was super tasty, so our risks paid off. You even get to substitute brown rice for white without a surcharge, and it comes with 2 pieces of the softest naan. Perhaps after seeing that we all got the same thing, the owner brought us a complimentary chicken curry dish that was excellent, but more on the spicy side. He also gave us an extra order of naan. So nice! 

We had such a wonderful time, and felt really taken care of.

P.S. Yelp check in gets you a free glass of white or red!
author: Karen S.

description:
The best Nepalese restaurant in San Francisco. I tried many Indian and Nepalese restaurants in San Francisco City but i found healthy and delicious food in Cusine of Nepal. I love MoMo , Chicken Tandoori. Yummy,,, I ordered Thali today with lamb curry, which was beyond my expectation. Good thing about this restaurant isnot only food, Price is reasonable in expensive SF. I recommend Cusine of India everyone, who loves Nepali/ Indian food. Employees are friendly.
    Great food in Mission st & Cortland. I am sure you gonna Love this place
author: Umesh B.

description:
It's a quaint establishment in the bernal heights / noe neighborhoods that serves pretty authentic foods. We got the sizzling mixed platter which was good but may be a tad overpriced for how much food there was. However, great presentation and quality, just a tad on the bland side in terms of flavoring. 

The curry we picked was the butternut squash one which was great! I'm sure there might be others though that's even better so next time will probably try a different curry. Overall, very satisfied with my meal and the service.
author: Lucy G.

description: The dumplings (we had the pork) and the spicy sauce that go with it are tasty, while a small restaurant, even on Saturday night we were able to find a seat at peak time.  Staff could not be more helpful and attentive even with a full house, would definitely go back
author: Bernie W.

description:
Another Friday night, another round of delivery from Cuisine of Nepal. Easily the best food delivery in the Bernal Heights area. Love the chicken cashew curry and the lamb choila. Trying the sizzling prawns tonight. The samosas travel well and usually arrive hot. The palak paneer is yummy - as is the garlic naan. 

I'd really like to go in and eat sometime. Stopped by one night on my way home from Old Devil Moon just to thank the owner for making delicious food and delivering it to us - and he was very kind and humble.
author: Caryl S.

description:
Feeling hot, hot, hot! We are suckers for flavor and spice and this place brings both. As a person who orders Indian food from the same place once a week, I was in the mood for something a little different. I stumbled upon Cuisine of Nepal and crossed my fingers that they would deliver to my area. Just a short wait later and I was sweating like a pig in heat heaven after ticking off the "extra hot" option. 

Their flavors are on point and aren't lost to the heat. (You know how some places when you say extra hot you either get a "you didn't really mean extra hot" hot or you get a mouth full of chili powder? Yeah, not this place). 

In the words of Shia LeBeouf: "DO IT. JUST, DO IT! Don't let your dreams be dreams." 

Pros
Great flavor 
They can make it hot
Good value 
Fast service 

Cons
I didn't find them sooner
author: Kat M.

description:
It was a Saturday morning and it started out like all Saturday mornings: I woke up at 4:30 am and cursed. I looked at my phone to see when my alarm will go off, only to realize it wasn't Monday...it was the weekend! YAS (SFW): http://bit.ly/27TSTvP!

Except hours later while flip flopping in bed, I realized that I had an appointment in 30 minutes. I hightailed outta the house and made my way to The Mission.

On my home from my appointment, I was hangry and passed by the newly opened Cuisine of Nepal (formerly Chan's Cuisine across from Zante's). I walked in disheveled in sweats covered with Tater fur, flip flops, a hair nest, and my grandma grey eyebrows (thanks to a botched tattoo job when I was 16) . 

The Owner/Chef Prem welcomed me with open arms and told me to sit at any available table. I intended to do take-out because of the aforementioned but I was the only one there so I figure that I just dine in. Shit, I hope I don't meet Mr. Right today, at least not Mr. Right Now, I thought to myself. 

Cuisine of Nepal is from the owner/chef of Little Nepal, a beloved Bernal Heights neighborhood favorite: http://bit.ly/1XV86sk. It's my understanding that once Little Nepal's lease is over on Cortland, he will make the full transition to Cuisine of Nepal. The menu is similar serving momos, samosas, curries, sizzling meat platters, naan, etc. Prices are a tad high with an individually portioned entrée with rice ranging from $11.99 (vegetarian) to $15.99 (chicken, lamb, shrimp). For an additional $2, you can make your meal a combo with lentils, a veggie stew, and chutney. NO msg is used. Wine and beer only. They also offer free delivery within a 5 mile radius. 

I love nuts everything so I ordered the Kukhurako Ledo: Chicken Cashew Cream Curry w/ clay oven flamed-roasted chicken, buttered naan, basmati rice ($15.99). Initially, I thought the pricing seemed a little high for Asian food but it all made sense when my order arrived: http://bit.ly/1TGGRys. Everything is made to order and Chef Prem takes great pride in his food. He explained to me how he made the cashew cream curry (he can leave out the cream for vegans); grinding the cashews by hand, caramelizing the onions, to making the tomato chutney. It's all about building those layer of flavors and it shows (all without the use of msg). 

Upon my first bite, I melted into my seat in utter satisfaction. The sauce was velvety smooth, incredibly rich, wonderfully spiced, and mildly spicy. Similar to a Tikka Masala or Butter Chicken sauce without all that grease from butter or ghee since cashew cream is used instead. Dunking the freshly made, piping hot buttered naan into the curry was sublime. Not a fan of white chicken meat unless I'm eating salads but the white chunks of chicken were nicely tender. I could of finished everything in one sitting but I took half home so I can savor for later. I ate the leftovers 2 days later and the sauce was even better as the flavors developed even more. That cashew cream curry is everything...it will make even shoe leather taste good so this dish is highly recommended.

Service was very swift, hospitable, and attentive since I was the only one there at the time. I wanted to get my weekend buzz going so I wanted to enjoy a beer with my lunch. They didn't have the small 12 oz bottle of the Taj Mahal in stock but Chef Prem popped open a 22 oz, and told me to drink as much as I can, and he will only charge me for the small bottle. Such a kind gesture that was much appreciated.  

The building has an odd layout. As you enter, you're basically walking through a narrow hallway of two tops and then they have larger tables in the back to seat two groups of six, with total seating for 30. They did the best they could to utilize the space and turn it into a homey, neighborhood restaurant.

As I finishing up lunch, a female solicitor walks in with bags of makeup. She gives her sales pitch to the Chef Prem and I, and asks if we wanted to buy the bag of discounted makeup for $20 ($100 value). 

Chef Prem: "Sorry, I don't wear makeup but do you want a cup of hot tea." (See how nice this guy is!)

Solicitor *Looks at me*

Me: "No, thank you." 

Solicitor: "But, I have a really good mascara...make you look sexy."

Me: "No, thank you." 

*Telepathing to her that I don't normally look like horse manure*

Solicitor: "Dun you waaan booooifriiiien?"

Ooooh nooooo, she diiiidin't. 

*Z-line snap*
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Loved their lamb in basil curry and andako curry with spinach. Beer was wonderful and the hospitality was great
author: Ankhi S.

description:
Super nice family run restaurant at the edge of the Mission/Bernal. It's far enough away from Valencia St to feel like a real neighborhood locals type of place without any of the crazy lines and tipsy loud patrons of the chic chic places further north. My friends and I enjoyed a lovely meal together including 

 * Momos ($6.99 pork) - I've been eating homemade potstickers all my life and though I like the momos I don't like them as much as I love potstickers. The momos have a thicker chewier dough which I didn't care for though the chutney for dipping was very good.

* Nagala Sya ($16.99 Traditional Chicken Curry combo) - This was probably my favorite dish of the evening. Super tender chicken. Nice flavored curry.

 * Pharsi ($15.99 Pumpkin Curry combo) - Okay but didn't stand out compared to the chicken.

 * Aloo Ra Cauli Tarkari ($14.99 Potato Cauliflower Curry combo) - A nice variation on the familiar Indian Aloo Gobi. Potatoes and cauliflower were nicely cooked and the curry had a nice flavor too.

 * Poleko Bheda ($18.99 Sizzling Lamb Platter combo) - It was just a lamb kebab off the stick. The lamb was tasty though not as tender as the chicken. I think I'm just not a huge fan of kebabs.

You can get each platter as a la carte with naan and rice, or as a combo with naan, rice, lentils, mixed vegetables, chutney. We opted to go with the combo for 4 of us. The naan was really good - thin, chewy, buttery, more moist and less bready than most naans. The lentils and mixed veg were also nice but probably not necessary as we were super stuffed by the end of the meal.

For the momos, 4 combo dishes, and 2 large beers it was only $95 before tip. 

This place is super popular on weekends judging from the crowd on Saturday night. The tables were all full when we walked in (except for ours) and full again when we left. Definitely make reservations if you want a spot without a wait though just 24h notice is enough to secure a table.
author: Jean K.

description:
This was my first time here.  I loved this place.  It was awesome.  I ate until I couldn't eat anymore. 

I would definitely come back. 

Don't forget to check in on yelp for your free glass of wine.  Totally worth it.
author: Charles J.

description:
both hands were still shattered from the car crash so i ordered delivery to my monastery. 2 entrees & a drink showed up in just under an hour, not bad.

"kukhura"? is that my mantra?
no it's the wifi password we're not savages.

after dinner some bald granmilf showed me how to swirl sparks in the air and teleport.

(^_^) Kukhura Ra Saag Tarkari
mmm spinach chicken curry
"no spicy" still spicy at bottom - surprise! lol

(^_^) Iced Tea
fat chub cup like bubble tea

(-_^) Naan
plain taste but handy w other foods

(-_-) Poleko Bheda
very tough lamb wish tender instead

(?_?) Brizzown Rice
idk didn't eat it i'm not a rice person

i didn't order naan but it was in the delivery bag. lucky for me bc it was the perfect thing to put the curry on.

in the future i'll stick to their curries or other "wet" dishes n automatically avoid dry meats.
author: Dan B.

description: This place is from outerspace food was so good and delivery time was fast. Got the the combo plate of salmon, lamb and chicken kehbob with lentil soup with some garlic nan they even threw in a extra nan. Food was just so good that I took one of the best naps afterwords. Try it for yourself and see what i am talking about!
author: Carlos Z.

description: Very heavy food. Service is great and food is just average. Smaller portions, but you get full. Had curry chicken
author: Why-Tie Z.

description: Came here to meet my best friend for a nice dinner. There was no wait which was nice. However the food we ordered was quite dry. We barley touched our food and did not pack it to go. We were both upset with how pricey the food was and the outcome. I don't mind spending money on food as long as it's good. The only good thing is if you check in on yelp you get a free glass on wine! I will definitely not be back to eat here again.
author: Nhi N.

description:
Great tasty authentic food - fast. We've never eaten in the place, we always take it to go. 

Living in Bernoe Park Heights, this has become our new "go-to" spot. They always "over-deliver" on stuff. One time, we ordered two things, then we get 8 containers, plus the naaan - what? And the naan dipping sauce to boot - so, really 10 containers. 

Also, a nice big +: vegetables are never over-cooked. 

No one can argue it's all made with love, and that's really what matters. Huge fan of this place, we're counting on it being around for years to come.
author: Ches W.

description: This used to be on the Yelp Top 100 restaurant list but I'm not sure why. It's definitely good food, but not quite as good as I expected it to be considering it's ranking on the list. Great and pretty quick service, and definitely quite good food.
author: Cassie P.

description: This place ROCKS. It's a small mom & pop type restaurant whose decor is cheesy in the perfect way. Hands down the BEST service I've had in SF. It was obvious that our server loved the food that they served and wanted us to enjoy it as much as he did. Per all the reviews on here we got the chicken momos and cashew chicken. Both incredible!! 11/10 would recommend
author: Melissa F.

description: Absolutely amazing I almost had every single Indian restaurant in the city this is just something different and amazing loved it definitely coming back
author: Hardish S.

description: Been walking past this place for a while and finally decided to try it out. Glad I did. The dishes were excellent, and service was attentive and friendly. I walked away stuffed and already looking forward to my next visit.
author: Ryan D.

description: This spot is cool, great food, small so make a reservation.  We love the service and it makes for a good hearty meal.  Good to go on couples night or a double date night.
author: Elaine v.

description:
Was here recently to celebrate a friend's birthday. The service was terrific. The staff was patient and checked on us. Unfortunately, the meats were overcooked. We had two types of lamb, kebob and grilled ... the portions of meat were great except that it was overcooked and a bit tough. The salmon kebob was also overcooked. 

I wish I could give them more stars just for their attentiveness and service.
author: Steven L.

description: We ordered the cashew chicken curry and the butternut squash curry. The serving sizes were big and the food was delicious. Also, the customer service was fantastic! They accommodated a group of four even without reservations during a busy evening. After hearing that this was our first time at their restaurant, they gave us a bowl of rice on the house and asked us if we wanted more naan. Definitely coming back.
author: S F.

description: SO good!! Had the tofu and green bean curry- highly recommend that or something with that same sauce! Chicken curry was also very good!
author: Kim B.

description:
Wow! This is my new go to spot! I've been ordering from Spicy Bite for the past 5 years, but because they have gotten steadily worse, I began looking for a new spot! 

First of all, the man who answered the phone was super-polite and answered all of my questions about the menu. I told him about my disappointment with Spicy Bite and he assured me that they would do their best to win me over, and boy did they! 

I ordered the Himalayan Momos, (pork) which are steamed dumplings that I've never had before and they were amazing! They arrived hot, the texture and balance were perfect and I'd definitely recommend them. 

I also ordered the chicken tikka masala and it was the best I've ever had, bar-none. Very creamy and the chicken was incredibly tender. Like I said, the best I've ever had. And it should be noted that, unlike Spicy Bite, the rice and the naan are included, and both were equally fantastic! 

The delivery time was exceptionally short, (35 minutes) and the food arrived hot and prepared exquisitely! Even the delivery driver was super-nice! I love love love this place! Definitely my new go to spot!
author: Herbert C.

description: Really enjoyed my meal here on Friday night. Our appetizers included lamb samosas and pakoras, both great. We ordered five main dishes - all delicious! The ones that stood out for me were the cashew chicken curry, lamb curry, sizzling chicken and my spinach chickpea and tomato curry. I recommend making each dish a combo and sharing the entrees so that you each have your own plate of rice, naan and side dishes. It's only $2 more and more than worth it. Also, make sure to check in for a free glass of house wine!
author: Julia C.

description:
Stop looking, come here. The food is authentic and spectacular. Prem (head chef) and his team go above and beyond to make you feel welcome - you're treated like a friend. The food is consistently cooked just right, and you can tailor spiciness to your palate. The momos (Nepali dumplings) are amazing, and they've aced the achar (sauce) served with them.

Prem and team, my girlfriend and I love your restaurant. Thank you!
author: Patrick C.

description:
Eating at Cuisine of Nepal is like turning off of Mission Street directly into a cumulus cloud.  The humble but tactful decor welcomes you into the corridor of a dining area that is equally well-suited to a family affair or a spicy hot date. 

Speaking of spicy, the food was tremendously flavorful.  The mango beverage was like a fresh summer breeze cascading directly from the top shelf for all of $3.  We started out with some terrific samosas, which were the best we have ever had and were accompanied by some even better sauces.  The momos are an absolute must order whether you eat them daily or you've never tasted one (my favorite item of the dinner).  We ordered three vegetarian curries, each of which had a unique personality, and my mouth is watering just thinking about them now!  As far as we could tell, you absolutely cannot go wrong with this spot, I'm serious, we will all undoubtedly come back to this spot.  

The outrageously good food actually paled in comparison to the man himself: Prem Tamang, the genuine, kind and talented chef who inspired this review.  He was involved with our table from the beginning and seemed to have a friendly relationship with many of the customers in there: both the regulars and the newbies.  

If you're looking for an affordable, delicious, and unique experience, plug this himalayan gem into your GPS right now.  Maybe I'll see ya there!
author: Saul L.

description:
The service is very attentive and nice. I've never had nepal food before and it was delicious. Chef brought out our food which was such a nice gesture!

We ordered the squash curry and the salmon. I would definitely come back for the curry. ALWAYS do the combo. It's only a few dollars more, but so much food. I'll be back soon!
author: May W.

description: Delicious interesting food! Our family ate a wonderful warm spicy meal here last night. We had an enormous platter of fries vegetables with tangy sauces and momo vegetable dumplings. Then we shared palak paneer, sizzling prawns, Dahl, spicy lamb, and a potato cauliflower combination.  Mildly spicy and very delicious!
author: Charles L.

description:
This is legitimately one of my favorite food in the entire city. Quality is incredible for the price you pay, and man, it's yummy. 
The owner is super nice to talk to and really gets out of his way to make sure you're well taken care of too. 
Fantastic.
author: jef p.

description: Great food and customer service! I love this restaurant! The chicken cashew curry is my favorite! The owner is a great hostess and always checks on your table.
author: Bernadette P.

description:
Cozy little restaurant with the nicest chef/owner I have ever met. The food was DELICIOUS  !!

We got the dumplings and chicken kebab - It was da bomb
author: Thao P.

description:
Wow!! The food here is delicious, generous servings, and unbelievable flavors. We had cashew chicken curry, the chicken dumplings, butternut squash curry, a bone-in chicken dish and garlic naan. Everything was so delicious. I can't wait to try more things. 

The owner of the restaurant was walking around, talking to patrons, and making sure everyone was having a good time. He made our experience so special. 

This place is a gem.
author: Elina P.

description: Best Nepali/Indian food in sf. Cashew chicken is the bomb, but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Also they have free delivery if you're not in Bernal heights, and modestly priced drinks if you are. Also friendly staff
author: Aakash A.

description: This is my favorite Nepalese restaurant. The lamb is so tender and juicy it's unbelievably good it's unbelievably good !! I love the fact that the owner / head chef comes to your table to make sure everything is okay that's awesome! If you've never been to Cuisine of Nepal you need to make it a point to go you will not be disappointed. Not only is the food Great.... the wait staff is Awesome.!!
author: Rachel O.

description: I made a Yelp account just to say how wonderful & kind the staff at this restaurant is. I was having a rough day and their kindness went such a long way. Also, the tofu curry was the recommendation of the (owner? staff? I wish I asked his name!) and it was amazing. Thank you so much. I'll eat here every time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Tyler R.

description:
If you're looking for a wonderful time with friends or family over some solid Nepalese food in a comfortable setting with exceptional service, Cuisine of Nepal is the way to go!

I came here with a party of three on a Friday night and had a splendid meal and experience here. The ambiance is more on casual side which is also reflected in the food that I felt leant more towards homemade as opposed to restaurant meticulousness.The service was on point as our server was always smiling and friendly, and he was quick to fulfill any requests we had. We decided on ordering the Bhojan set menu for two people of which our server notified us would be enough for the three of us. The set meal also came with complimentary house wine, though I'm told it's not the greatest of drinks.

The first plate to arrive consisted of pieces of chicken, two large samosas, and four chicken momos. Three sauces also came with this plate: spicy tomato, a sweet bbq-like sauce, and mint chutney. Each sauce was easily distinguishable in taste from the others which led to completely unique and different experiences depending on the food/sauce combination. The chicken was splendidly grilled with some char on it. It also had an abundance of flavor and a nice spicy kick to it. I would say that this chicken was one of the highlights of the meal. The samosas were nicely fried and filled with a perfectly mushy and starchy filling that also had a good amount of spiciness to it.
