The chicken momos reminded me of Chinese potstickers, but with spices added in and a curry flavor.

The main entrees included a sizzling chicken dish, black-eyed pea + bamboo shoot curry, and two plates of naan with rice, lentil soup, and vegetable soup. The chicken dish was similar in flavor to the chicken in the starter. The main differences were that the pieces were larger and the texture was a tad bit chewier which could've been somewhat better. The curry had a thin consistency almost like a broth and went excellently with the rice albeit not the most memorable dish. The naan was a pleasant surprise however. It somehow felt both lighter and chewier than the naan I would get from any typical Indian restaurant. I enjoyed it quite a bit, especially in tandem with the lentil soup and the vegetable soup.
author: Joshua M.

description:
Delicious Nepalese food!  Similar to Pakistani or Northern Indian food, with rich, boldly spiced curries and stir-fries.  We got the chili chicken and traditional chicken curry, and pork momos (dumplings) -- all fantastic.

5 stars for the food!  I plan to get takeout frequently!

The one thing you should be aware of when coming is the ambience, or lack thereof.  Most of the restaurant is down a narrow hallway connecting the front door to the main dining room and kitchen, which only seats about 12.  The entire restaurant can probably 35 diners at a time, and it sounds like it's quite busy at dinner.  Definitely not a good date or business meeting location - suitable only for casual meals.

The staff is very friendly - seems like a family-run restaurant.  The chef came out to check on us, and the server was very attentive and talkative.
author: Greg B.

description: I ordered the Tofu Takari combo (soft tofu in giant pieces, perfectly cooked, very spicy) and the veggie Momo. This was enough food for three delicious meals for one person. Delivery was zippy and arrived hot.
author: Phoebe O.

description: Ate here just a couple hours ago with my wife and could not have been happier with our meal. The food was so fresh and flavorful and we absolutely loved everything we ordered. The restaurant was very cozy and had a great environment that felt welcoming to all. We also loved the care that the chef and everyone working took to make sure we were taken care of. We are just visiting but want to go back before we leave. We would definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Alex B.

description:
The food here is amazing, even if I know very little about Nepalese food I am always happy to learn more through my palate.

Tip: get the soup and get a veggie curry combo. The mixture of sauces with veggies is superb.

The owner is very attentive to detail, and he works very hard for this restaurant. I respect that. He is always very welcoming and friendly.

Lastly, the chai tea is bomb
author: Edward F.

description: This place is such a treasure. The food is absolutely delicious and Prem (the owner/chef) is incredibly friendly and generous. Nepalese food is similar to Indian food in many respects but this place blows most of the Indian and other Nepalese places I've been to out of the water. The food is incredibly flavorful and fresh. Prem brought us extra spicy chicken curry and a small sample of the cashew curry to try and was very generous with the wine. You can tell that he truly loves making this food and is really such a wonderful host. I highly highly recommend supporting this business! You will not be disappointed!
author: Vidya P.

description:
Ordered pick up on Yelp Eat24. 
I got the recommended choices:
chicken curry-which was very delicious and was light
chicken momo-filing and had a good sauce
butter nan-good and not too oily, ordered 2 portions and it was more than enough, for 2 you can just get one order
eggplant-very flavorful  
They had the food ready in the pick up time and was very friendly. The inside of the restaurant was very cute, will definitely come back to eat inside.
author: Van N.

description: Love the spice in the dishes. I thought the momo was fabulous! The service was warm and homely. My party had a kid who made quite a mess and we felt bad about it, yet the service was gracious and accommodating throughout.
author: Stan L.

description:
I ordered for delivery. The dumplings arrives all smashed together having been wrapped in aluminum foil one on top of the other. They were VERY spicy. 

I realize that what is hot and what is mild is a matter of perspective, but I did order the rest of the dishes "mild" and they were too much for me. In most other places, I can enjoy rather than endure certainly not have to throw away something I order "mild." 

I see the many raves reviews and know this might have been an off-night or maybe this is just not the place for me. But I won't risk another $30+ to try it out.
author: Paul R.

description: Great food，gracious owner with great service，Soooo Good！So much love for this place..
author: Tony X.

description:
Takeout from here is amazing and my favorite dishes are ones I haven't found elsewhere - like the Kranti Daal and the Tofu Tarkari.

Yum.
author: Masha G.

description: We were traveling in San Francisco and decided to stop here based on the ratings. Very good food and service. The owner actually waited on us and was very helpful. He even brought out a complementary plate for our toddler. Another bonus is  street parking is easy and Mitchell's ice cream is just down the street!
author: George H.

description: Place is bomb. Especially on those chilly nights. Ordered the chicken and spinach on medium to be conservative but definitely going hot next time around
author: Alan B.

description:
This place is delicious and has an amazing atmosphere. The owner is super nice and comes out and talks to you before your meal. I don't eat spicy food at all but it was totally bearable and amazing. Highly recommended I had #9 cashew chicken curry and I basically licked the plate. 
Enjoy!
author: Michelle A.

description: Great tasting flavors. Got the momo's, veggie and pork both were great. Also got the stir-fried egg noodles which were also delicious!
author: Phoenix I.

description: One of my favorite restaurants SF. I enjoy the thick flavor of food and extra friendly service here. This place is so earthy yet so supreme.
author: Zhizhou H.

description:
The other reviews for this place are very accurate. I'd give it 10 stars if I could! We came on a quiet Tuesday night and the place was almost full. The restaurant itself is pretty small but they just started doing deliveries--I can tell this is going to be become one of my go to delivery options. 

We ordered the chicken curry and mixed meat combo. The portions were huge! The combo comes with 2 pieces of naan, rice, dhal, and vegetable curry. Honestly all that alone would have filled me up. I had more than enough left overs for lunch the next day. The chicken curry was a little thicker, and more tomato based than I'm used to, but delicious nonetheless. The mixed meat came with chicken, lamb and salmon on a sizzling platter. I thought the lamb was a little overcooked but it wasn't horrible. 

The owner, Prem, was there that night as well and was very attentive and friendly. They were having a bit of a crazy night since a few of his staff members called in sick, and offered us dessert on the house since we had to wait a few minutes to be seated. You can read more about his background in the menu, I won't spoil it but it's worth the read.
author: Trena M.

description: Bright, tight, busy restaurant with friendly chef-owner greeting and seating guests. We chose the platter for 2, so we could try a few different things, and they were all tasty, with some unique spicy and sweetly sour sauces. I only wish the flavor profiles of the main dish items on the sharing platter weren't so similar. The level of spice was high enough that it overshadowed some of the nuances of the other flavors (we did not specify our heat level). Maybe I was just jealous of our table mate, who ordered the cashew chicken cream, which was soooo yummy (but not included in the sharing platter), and would have been a nice sweet, rich complement to our spicy dishes. Overall, the little bustling place with excellent service, interesting sauces, and the smell of fired meats in the air made for a really nice evening.
author: H M.

description: One of the most authentic Nepalese food in SF. The portion sizes are pretty good and few but great options for vegetarians as well. I never miss their full milk tea and Chana palak. The combo meal comes with dal and a veggie of the day. Great service and very friendly staff. This place won't disappoint.
author: Nupur G.

description: Authentic cuisine, friendly service, perfect portions, very tasty! So glad I live close by. I will be back again and will be sure to bring visitors & family to experience the best Napalese food in SF!
author: Lissette I.

description: Very nice restaurant. I ordered my Lamb Curry to be hot. And for once the hot spicy was actually spicy. A lot of food for $15. Got a dish of lamb curry, 4 pieces of naan, and a container of rice for that price. Would definitely recommend.
author: Josh C.

description: Super fast delivery! We ordered the butter chicken, the okra dish, palek paneer, and paneer tikka masala. Food was tasty but I think I prefer a stronger spice level- I thought the food was creamy/fatty/oily but could have used more uuumph.
author: Jean L.

description: Delish! We came with a big group (18) and they were so accommodating. The food was great--pretty sure we had one of everything but I personally had the lentil soup (do not skip it!), butternut squash curry combo, and lamb curry. Definitely would return.
author: jennifer k.

description: The Cuisine of Nepal fairly recently opened. Restaurant serves Nepalese & Himalayan cuisine. Little place. Gentle service. Excellent foods!! I'm unable to repeat what we ordered, but I can tell you both chicken entrees were made in Clay oven. (I believe #'s 40 & 43). Butter Naan & white or brown rice comes with a la carte entrees. Typical al a carte prices $13.99 to $15.99. Many available vegetarian dishes also. Beer & wine, too. Our favorite part was the owner softly checked in with us to see what we thought, or if we needed anything! Refilled our glasses, offered a little chitchat, very sweet. Sorry we can't eat here as often as we'd like!! We'd be regular dukes!
author: Van H.

description: very good Indian food! I ate here on a total whim and was not disapointed. The Curry was like no Curry I have ever had. totally blew me away. Fun friendly and talkative staff was just icing on the cake. I totally recommend anyone to give this place a try.
author: Legion M.

description: Normally, I just need one great dish to want to come back to a restaurant, and at Cuisine of Nepal that dish is the Chili Chicken appetizer.  Yum.  I've been to Nepal, and have tried other Nepali restaurants, and this is by far the best Nepali food I have ever eaten. Small, comfortable restaurant with good service.  (Unlike virtually everyone else who wrote a review, I found the Chicken Cashew Cream Curry to be rather boring.)
author: Robert R.

description:
Came back for my friend's birthday--still unbelievably good.
The owner treated my friend and I to free beers, and even brought out dessert with a candle for my friend. He often checked up on us and talked to us about his life and restaurant, and I've really never felt so comfortable in a restaurant before.
The food here is great as ever--still recommending the chicken cashew cream curry, and this time I went for the combo which came with traditional Nepali sides. Lots of food, but so, so worth it.

Seriously, you have to try this place!
author: Gautam G.

description:
Very homely service, tasty and fresh food and good ambiance is the simple definition of Cousin of Nepal. This place is a small cozy one to reflect some corner restaurants of Kathmandu's streets. 
Sunde chicken and sekuwa are my favorite. I already ate 5 times. Every single time I eat here i have found the taste very consistent. 

Chef Prem is always bg cooking inside while his wife Kumari is very humble to greet and serve their patrons to make sure everybody is served properly.

They deserve 5 star big time.
author: Laxman A.

description: Best Food of Himalayan Origin. Delicious chicken breast cooked in Authentic homemade style. Everything tasted authentic Nepalese. Awesome place, and thumbs up to the owner. Must go place in SFO
author: A'neil T.

description:
We ordered Sizzling Meat and Fish Platter. The quality of meat was subpar. It took an eternity to cook 5 little pieces of meat, of which salmon was overlooked to tasteless dryness. The portions are really little and the taste is inauthentic. It is possibly good for people who know little about Nepalese cuisine and want an Americanized version of Asian cuisine. The owner/chef is very passionate but the operation is unorganized.
The smoke from the clay oven doesn't help the experience either. They have the American pricing but not worth portions of Costco quality meet served after a long long wait.
author: Deepa G.

description:
This place is really good.
Started with himalayan momo
then got the channa saag and Khasi ra tulsi - basil lamb
It had a combo option which came with rice and a naan. 

I love the food. and the service. Ambiance was bright and clear with fun wall hangings. 
A must try.
author: Prashanth V.

description:
The food was incredible. We had heard that he restaurant typically has a long wait time so we came in a little early before the dinner rush. It was definitely worth every penny. The flavors of the dishes were refined, interesting, and colorful. The depth of flavor had exceptional mouth feel. Overall deeply satisfied with this restaurant. Will definitely be coming back again and again! 

Ps. Ignore the lady who gave them four stars. She's whack!
author: Drew A.

description: A pleasant, soothing atmosphere where you can safely spend a lot of time, a good choice of menus, very responsive and unobtrusive staff.
author: Angel J.

description:
The lentil soup Jhol was amazing.. full of flavours. The vegetarian momos were lacking flavor and the sauce was not the authentic momo sauce. We also ordered the potato, black eye bean and bamboo shots curry combo which was also lacking flavor and taste.
Overall just liked the lentil soup and rest of the food was kind of just okish. Service was fast though.
author: Neha J.

description: Very authentic food from Nepal(I was there 6 months ago and did not feel the difference!) Great service, they are very nice and helpful. I strongly advice the combo since the sides are the actual very traditional meals in Nepal. I had some sizzling chicken and it was absolutely delicious, perfectly cooked and fresh! The momos are also good as an appetizer. You can definitely share a meal if you are not too hungry because the portions are big! Strongly recommend it!
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description: Thursday night, crowded people. Lots of people waited outside. You will know why after the first bite of your food. You better try naan and brown rice, also the dumplings！salmon curry and butter curry are both great.
author: Stacy W.

description: Randomly walked into this restaurant last night and it was amazing! The service was fast, friendly, and the food was delicious! The owner was touching tables throughout the night and you could tell he really cared about how everyone was enjoying their meal. I would absolutely come again.
author: Tanya C.

description: All dishes are very similar to their Indian counter part but we found the vegetarian food quite different .The host of this place are really nice and welcoming !!
author: Anand S.

description:
Great food, good prices and courteous staff!
I been here thrice and would want to come back..
author: Alex P.

description:
The flavors were really nice and strong. The curries had a unique taste that is different from Indian, Thai and others. We liked our cauliflower and potato curry the best but the chicken curry was also very good. The sides that come with the combo are also very good - a black lentil and a veggie mix - again with very good flavor. The reason I give only 4 stars is that the prices were a bit high relative to very good Indian or other Asian cuisine. If it was $12-15 for a main that would be great, but $17-20 is a bit high for maximizing value.

Service is amazing and they are very attentive. They also gave us a free glad of wine to go with the meal. Definitely a place to visit and if they do prices a bit a place to frequent!
author: Phil D.

description: Delicious food every time we order. They never disappoint. Since we moved from Florida, this is the one restaurant we've ordered from multiple times. Beware of the extra hot. They aren't lying!
author: Jason L.

description: Amazing food and a super friendly staff! The owner always greets you at the door and offers you wine if there is a wait. The food is very fresh and flavorful. I have never ordered anything that I didnt love. It is definitely some of the best Nepalese in the bay area. The atmosphere is colorful and cozy and perfect for small groups or dates. They also deliver or you can pickup.
author: M K.

description: The chicken Choila is mind blowing.the only reason i go there is  because of hospitable staffs delicious food, Fresh, good in portion and very intimate environment.
author: Niraj P.

description:
Wow
So glad I found out this place is in my neighborhood

And really this is why I need yelp, because the front of the place is so narrow and unassuming, I never noticed it before... But it was packed and I got take out and I'm still thinking about the curries five days later.

I don't think the lamb kebab was actually as good as the curries, a little tough. 

 Namaste
author: Craig S.

description: Aaja Prem Dai ko khana khana gako bajai Aama Ko yaad aayo. Kasto methio mero ratri bhojan prem-maya vayo. True Nepalese taste guys!!! Dai momo chahi Ali Nepali tarroo-pirro jasto pani rakhdinus. Dhanyabad.
author: Santosh G.

description: This place is insanely great. Good service, nice atmosphere. This is my go to spot at least a few times a week. Awesome place.
author: Quinn W.

description: i received a message from the owner about my previous review so i do appreciate he took the time to write me. he offered me a full refund which i don't think is necessary. at least i know they are good people.
author: Alyssa L.

description: Super delicious place! Good selection of dishes for a fun meal. Better go here with friends. Great service as well.
author: Frankie H.

description:
It is one thing to say how good the food is at a restaurant, but it is an entirely different thing altogether when you can say how great the owner and staff are. 
The service is amazing and the food is equally as good. Those two things keep my wife and I coming back.
Make it a point to check this place out, and definitely get the cashew curry dish with paneer.
author: Matt H.

description:
If you're hungry order now, as they took almost an hour to get our food...and be that is it may, the food more than made up for it.

Lamb samosa: big and beautiful!  the dough was crispy on the edges but doughy everywhere else.  The lamb and peas were plentiful and perfect as an app.
Kukhurako Ledo: So Good! The cashew cream is the perfect comfort food over the rice and the eaten with the naan (both naan and rice were made perfectly).
Bheda Ra Tulsi: Very good! the Lamb was cooked perfectly, and all the added spices and sauces completed the lamb so well. 

Definitely eat here!
author: Kris Marie D.

description:
Super YUM! Vegetarians (and meat-eaters) rejoice! This little slice of awesome just opened so stopped in to check it out and holy chutney, was glad that I did: best Momo dumplings ever - got the vegetable ones filled with chopped leeks, greens, etc; the outside was light, not too doughy, and the spicy dipping sauce was divine. 

Had the butternut squash curry for an entree, a crazy-good alternative to typical pumpkin curry served at local Thai joints, and it came automatically with naan and basmati rice. Sooo good... and a good deal.

Didn't try any chicken or lamb dishes but from the smells wafting over from the next table, definitely gonna check 'em out on the next visit (when I'm not with my herbivoric pal). If you're like me and have endless cravings for Indian and Thai food, this Nepali food is its own thing but is right there in the mix of tasty awesome. Highly recommended :)
author: Emily D.

description:
If you are looking for great flavors, amazing hospitality and overall superb experience, Cuisine of Nepal has got all that covered.

I went there on the first day they opened. I'm a food connoisseur and when I heard a new restaurant that caters for those who love international taste, I was very excited and ready to try it!!

I called my order in, my take out was ready on time. When I picked it up, the owner and chef greeted me in such genuine way. His niece, was there to help him out that day, and she as well was a doll.

Best wishes on your Grand Opening, Cuisine of Nepal!!

See you soon!!!
author: M David Ambrose G.

description: Authentic Nepali food. Best costumer service. Really enjoyed chitchatting with restaurant owner, Prem. He is really passionate about his work. We will definitely come back here.
author: Subita T.

description: Ordered the pork momo (dumplings), cashew cream chicken, and eggplant curry. Everything was incredibly flavorful and not too heavy. Also very good service. One of my favorite spots!!!
author: Molly N.

description: Amazing Pharsi curry! The owner got us a glass of wine on the house. Will be returning.
author: Tania C.

description: Wow. This place is incredible. The food is flavorful, the staff are attentive, and the owner came by our table to chat with us and give us free wine - we'll be back! We were a bigger group so we were able to order a little of everything and pass it around. Winners were the samosas, chicken momos, lamb curry, chicken cashew curry, all served with naan and rice on individual plates! I love supporting these kinds of businesses - we'll be back!!
author: Melanie M.

description:
Amazing! Delicious food & great service. The chef even came out at the end to ask how our food was.
GET THE CHICKEN CASHEW CREAM CURRY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Ariana K.

description: Fairly small restaurant with friendly, helpful wait staff, good presentation and outstanding flavor! Best chicken kebab I've had in a very long time. If you like Indian curry and loads of spicy flavor, this is a great choice. I will definitely be back!
author: Delta B.

description:
Decent food, good service. Great prices too especially for combo and a la carte. 

Will surely be back.
author: Milana R.

description:
We were around the area and decided to drop in for a quick dinner. The steamed Momo and Marsala chai tea definitely brought back fond memories from Nepal when we last trekked there. 

What stole the show was the Kukhurako Ledo Chicken Cashew Cream Curry. I opted for no rice hence there was extra butter naan which came with the dish. It turned out to be a great decision! 

I will be back to try the rest of the menu! Yummy!
author: Yizhi A.

description:
Great tasting flavors. Got the momo's, veggie and pork both were great. Also got the stir-fried egg noodles which were also delicious!

Would recommend, cheap and tasty!
author: Jack A.

description:
Cuisine of Nepal is a hole-in-the-wall. A hidden gem and those are usually the best!

The chicken cashew curry combo was very good. The cashew cream tasted so buttery and rich. It was an absolute hit at our table. We also got the traditional lamb curry combo. The lamb was tender. The best part was the chopped green onions and they put fresh ginger. Genius!! I love curries that substitute spices with veggies. They could have added powdered ginger only, but instead they took the time to chop ginger and add it to the curry. These are the little things that usually go unnoticed but make a huge difference in taste! Beautiful dish. 

We started with the samosas. Ordering one of lamb and one veggie. What struck me positively was the taste of the dough. It tasted so fresh, as if it was just made for us. I highly recommend ordering this starter.

The service was very very good!! Thank you very much for a great dinner. :-)) 

A definite YES. Go here ASAP.
author: Rawan Z.

description:
Wow! The food here is absolutely delicious! This was our first time trying Nepalese food, and the flavors were just so unique. 
We had the veggie egg noodles, chicken kebab, and the cashew curry chicken as well as the mint yogurt and mango shake. 
The chicken kebab was a bit spicy, so we ordered the mint yogurt to give our mouths a break. Howeveeeer, it was sooo tender and so flavorful, if you like spicy you're going to love this. 
The cashew curry chicken was out of this world. The curry was creamy and we ended up eating the sauce with naan bread and rice even after finishing the chicken. 
The noodles had a great variety of veggies, they were so delicious. 
Definitely coming back to this place!
author: Lamia R.

description: I order from here once a week. The cashew chicken and the Samosa's! The delivery is always on time or early. Good job Cuisine of Nepal.
author: Matt B.

description: I wanted to try something new so I ordered food from Cuisine of Nepal. I ordered a few things a la cart and a few apps- only issue I had was the delivery was super slow. I ordered at 6:30, didn't come until 8 something. That may have been eat24'a fault though. Anyway the portions were really small. I paid 50 something bucks and didn't receive enough to feed 3 adults. Oh and please add the quantities of your samosas because that was very confusing. Cheers.
author: S B.

description: The momos are very good and their achchar is really on point. Would suggest adding more vegetarian momo options to the menu like paneer and mushroom momos.
author: Hiyanthi P.

description: The chef was awesome and the food was amazing!  Ordered the lamb basil curry and it's great.  If you like lamb and basil, order it!
author: Dee P.

description:
Some people open restaurants to make money, others open them because it's their passion. The owner here is definitely the latter; he makes time to socialize with each guest and offers personable and high quality service to everyone who walks in. 

Free wine (4 glasses??), top notch service, and tasty food. I don't come to bernal often, but will make a point to do so just so I can return.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Absolutely delicious! The creamy cashew chicken curry is amazing. The lamb kebab was slightly overcooked but tasty and good quality. Definitely coming back soon!
author: Jared S.

description: Great food! We ordered for 30 people for a lunch meeting and it was delivered on time and hot. I was also very pleased with their friendly and personal service. Ordering was a breeze as they helped with deciding dishes and determining quantities. A+
author: Justin L.

description: Delicious! I had food delivered from their restaurant and was very surprised at the quality and taste of the food. It was all really good. The garlic naan bread was perfectly cooked and not too garlicky and the chicken dishes were so delicious and flavorful. I also had the veggie dumplings which were pretty good but not my favorite.
author: Joni W.

description: Great food at affordable prices. Chef offered complimentary wine and came to check that we liked the food and that it was good. Their momos and thalis are the best!
author: Thulasi N.

description: Great food and nice staff. Owner was a lovely man that changed our yelp voucher wine into a beer we wanted and guided us to excellent dishes. Can recommend the ribs and the eggplant dish
author: Roadtrip T.

description: Chef Prem and his staff do a fantastic job at providing a great dining experience! The restaurant has a lot of local charm, and the food is excellent! Try the pork momos, chicken curry, and mango shake.
author: Bethany O.

description:
Amazing! I've never written a review but felt so compelled after my experience at Cuisine of Nepal. 
Food: 5 stars! The food was amazing. I got the chicken curry (neighborhood favorite) and my girlfriend got the chicken Kebab. Both dishes were amazing but the chicken curry really was one of a kind. The accompanying lentil soup garlic naan and rice were the perfect compliment and really felt authentic. Even the dishes the food was served in were different and added another layer of authenticity.

Service: 5 stars:
The owner happened to be our waiter and you really get the sense that he loves what he is doing and pours his heart and soul into the restaurant. An added benefit is he is the head chef so his recommendations are spot on based on your preferences. With him, it was the little things that ultimately won us over. For instance, when my girlfriend made a comment about how delicious the lentil soup was he returned with some more for her and when I asked about spicing up my curry dish he politely suggested against that given the spiciness would have overpowered the curry and creamy flavor (he was right) and instead he brought me out a small side dish of chicken in a spicy sauce to try (which of course was amazing) all free of charge! 

I'm just visiting the San Fran area but this will undoubtedly be a go to spot everytime I come back.
author: Caleb W.

description: We come to this place very often. The owner is a great guy he greets us with a big smile every time we come. It is a very friendly family owned and operated establishment. The food is delicious very fresh, and authentic, not your commercial type place.
author: Nick P.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in SF. I rarely crave food from a restaurant but I crave the cashew chicken curry from here soooo much! One of their best dishes! The owner is extremely nice and friendly. He comes around to talk to everyone to make sure everything is perfect. Feels like family!
author: Jonny M.

description: Very nice place. It's nothing fancy but the food was excellent and the staff was incredibly friendly.  When you say spicy they really mean spicy so watch how you order it. Everything is reasonably priced and would definitely recommend for anyone who's craving Nepali food or just wants to try something new.
author: George T.

description: Love this place! Good prices and fantastic food. The owner is also the nicest man and really cares about you having a great experience.  My boyfriend and I got the prix fix menu and it was a ton of yummy food. The owner offered us a free carafe of wine for our wait.  Will definitely return!
author: Ashley T.

description: Cozy bustling place with a diverse crowd and a friendly chef. Reminded me of the "old San Francisco." The food was home food type and was tasty. Good value and portion.
author: Andrew K.

description: My favorite. This place is AMAZING. Solid delivery and customer service.
author: Jillian M.

description:
Absolutely amazing experience of a new culture! We got the pork momo for app and potatoes and cauliflower curry and lamp basil curry! All dishes were fresh and full of flavor, and meat was very good quality. Pork momo was not overly loaded with pork, it had chickpeas base and was spicy! Both of the curries were medium spicy which was juts enough, and they were so different from the typical Indian kind of curry, which is what we were worried about it might taste like. We even got to try the fried vegetables appetizer from the couple next to us, it was fresh in the way that the oil they used for frying wasn't reused million of times. 
Overall, it felt like we were eating at friends house and lots of love was put into the food. Service was also very attentive and food arrived very quickly! Ahh also we got the half bottle of their house red wine, was very good price and taste. Next time we visit, we will be back to this little amazing heaven!
author: Olena D.

description: Interesting flavors. It's the OG Asian fusion food; I think of it as Indian/Thai/Taiwan food but with more herbal flavors similar to northern Chinese hotpot. Price is kind of high but that's SF?
author: Mike N.

description:
My boyfriend took me here on my birthday. It was a lovely meal!

We luckily had reservations for dinner as it was crowded on a Friday night. Service was great - we were quickly greeted by the owner and he checked up on us throughout the night. 

We ordered:

1) Chicken Cashew Curry combo meal. The curry was thick and flavorful, and I especially appreciated the light and toasted naan that came with the meal. You can also select between white or brown rice! 

2) Dawala Sikar (sizzing ribs platter) combo meal. The meat off the pork ribs was juicy, tender, and soaked in flavorful goodness.

3) Kheer rice pudding - This is served hot here, and was so yummy as a dessert.

4) Mango shake - We were told this was very popular. It was a sweet mango and yogurt (?) shake that complemented the curry well.

All the food was outstanding! We even had enough to bring back for leftovers. I highly recommend this place.
author: Mina K.

description: My favorite Indian restaurant at my fav city. The food is so authentic, spices are always on point.
author: Serina N.

description:
Yummy food and great service.... I think it is little over priced tho. 
We were 5 and 4 of us got the combo plates and it was perfect portion and was yummy, I got the chicken chowmien which i didnt like much but i loved the momo..... overall it was good.
author: Subodhani M.

description: The staff was really friendly-they offered wine to go with our meal (The wine was on the house). The food was amazing. There was no parking structure but there was street parking. Can't wait to go back!
author: Erica G.

description: great food! The chef even came to our table to introduce himself... and bring a tasty dessert to try! Highly recommend this place
author: Mandi J.

description:
This is one of more favorite places in the neighborhood. The owner is such an amazingly nice guy and their delivery is always prompt. 

The food is also very nicely done. It might be a bit more expensive then other options in the area but they do seem to use good ingredients and also give you a fair bit of food in the combo. They also spice their food pretty nicely, our favorite as the basil lamb curry and the mushroom curry.
author: Roko K.

description:
Came here for dinner last night with the boyfriend. 

We ordered the pork Himalayan Momo (steamed dumplings) and they were amazing. I've only had chinese dumplings before, and these are somewhat similar in appearance, but taste completely different and amazing. Love love love. I'd come back just for this! 

Ordered the Chicken Cashew Cream Curry and the Sizzling Lamb Platter. We did combo for both. They were both delicious. My boyfriend couldn't pick which one was his favorite, although I liked the curry just a slight tad more. 

This was such a great experience. The food was definitely spectacular. Oh, and the service was on point too.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
I strongly recomend this restaurant, basically I am not a good writer to write review but after eating in this restaurant it makes me to write a review on it, Comming to the Food in one word I can say that it is absolutely delicious, it feels me like I am in my home.

I remember owner name is prem how great he is, he invites every customer with great smile on his face. It makes me comfortable and eat like in my home.overall I deeply satisfied with this restaurant. I will come back again !
Thank you.
author: Bharath R.

description:
Ok-- so this is not your typical fancy SF Michelin star kinda place. 

Not too long ago, this was a greasy spoon Chinese food spot, mostly only ordered for delivery because the "ambience" was basically a small hallway with tables in it, where no one sat to eat. Overall just kind of an awkward vibe, with crayon drawings from on construction paper from their children (I assume?) on the walls. Very mom + pop, and really not the kind of place you take someone out for dinner. 

Now-- since this place has opened, there is rarely an empty table. They are literally just a long hallway with tables, so it is TINY, but they always make room for you no matter what. Everyone I have brought has loved it, and they are treated like family. The owner always remembers our face when we come in as he knows we're neighbors, and does something that goes above and beyond to show his appreciation for us coming in and bringing friends and family with us. It's family friendly, and people from all walks of life seem to enjoy it and feel at home. It is still very independent (one guy owns it, his wife is sometimes a server on busy nights, and those are pretty much the only people I usually see serving all of the tables), but is bustling. 

We love the Himalayan momo (they are klnd of like a potsticker, but filled with more Indian/Himalayan style spices and a chutney vs. oil/vinegar dipping sauce) as an appetizer, and always switch it up and share a few items for the main course. We LOVED the spinach and chicken cream curry (not appealing as a title, I know-- but delicious!)-- AKA Kukhura Ra Saag Tarkari. We got that as a combo, which comes with a yummy lentil dish and very flavorful vegetables. I got the minced lamb curry last time (Keema Tarkari), a la carte (which still comes with the rice and naan, but not the 2 extra sides) -- very good, but was definitely wanting more of the spinach chicken. 

Overall-- the spices are always INCREDIBLE, and the prices are very reasonable. We have been back many times since we can walk there from our house, and will definitely be back again.
author: Caitlyn D.

description:
The food was tasty. The staff needs seasoning.

We really enjoyed most of the dishes we ordered. In particular, the Chili Chicken appetizer was lovely, with a bit of a Szechuan flavor to it. All of the food tastes like it was made with fresh ingredients, even the traditional appetizer dipping sauces, which at some restaurants taste like they came from a bottle. 

However... service was not good. Upon arrival we were asked if we had a reservation. We did not, and though there were plenty of open tables, they had to think about where to seat us. They offered us a table by the door; it was a cold night and we declined. Next we were offered a table for two (we were 3 so we had to refuse again). Finally we were seated at a reasonable spot.

We ordered, and after awhile our first appetizer arrived. The Pakora were nice, with just enough kick for the American palate (probably milder than it would have been in Nepal). Then we sat. And sat. After another 20 minutes, a member of our party called a different waitress over. We basically had to give them our order again, as they'd lost it, and nobody had seemed to notice us sitting there with one empty plate on our table for all of that time.

The meal showed up fairly soon, and we enjoyed most of it, though the Eggplant Curry didn't taste much of curry, nor was it particularly piquant. Thereafter, we were visited by the waitress (we never saw our original waiter again) and the owner, who proceeded to give us 4 or 5 excuses why our order was lost: the computer lost it, the printer broke, it was late (really? 7:30 pm?), they were tired, etc. They tried very hard to convince us that we wanted to come back again, so much so that they drove us out of the restaurant (we didn't want to insult them, but they were insistent...).

The room is noisy; there seems to be a large number of staff behind the counter, and they managed to loudly drop piles of dishes a couple of times. They had problems with the lights several times too; while not much of an issue, it again suggests a lack of experience. We wish we loved our visit, but it's not just about the food.

Note to owners: you can't talk customers into loving you, nor your restaurant. That happens because the food and service are both great.
author: Nob T.

description: Amazing food and traditional atmosphere. Staff is very hospitable and food tastes the best in San Francisco. Especially chicken Momo's and lamb in traditional curry
author: Gurpreet S.

description: We went here for our 1st time! and WOW! The Food was so good!  The flavors with very different and distinctive. What Also made it great the staff was very good! They made us feel like we were apart of the family, the children loved it there so much they gave the owners a hug.  The portions were very good and we were all full at the end of the day. We had a party of 6 ( 3 children and 3 adults ).  Every dish was very fresh and flavorful, it had a lot of spice but not too hot. WE loved the Chili chicken, it was so flavorful but not heavy. Also, the Stir-fried egg noodles were so good, It was a very different taste and flavor than we ever had.  Make sure to get the garlic Naan and the mango lassi.  We are adding this restaurant to one of our favorite lists!
author: Veronica T.

description: This is the first time I've had Nepalese food but it's very similar to Indian food. And in that specific comparison, it's some of the best food I've ever had. First of all the spiciness is true to the description, so hot is legit hot (I eat a lot of spicy food and love my hot sauces). Next, the cashew chicken and spinach paneer were rich, perfectly seasoned and cooked. And the garlic naan was excellent. The only negative was delivery took longer than what was stated when we ordered through Yelp. But after tasting that food, it was well worth the wait.
author: Rohan M.

description:
Their delivery portions are HUUUUGE and generous. I ordered 3 main a la carte dishes and they bought so much more. 6-7 pieces of free naan, 3 boxes of rice, and the samosas were packed to the brim with meat (not to mention delicious).

Very awesome place and will order from them again.
author: Nikk G.

description: My friend took me to this place today and their food is absolutely amazing I can't wait if I can your restaurant have a delivered or go back to the restaurant food is awesome.
author: Yondome C.

description:
wow wow wow. a friend and i shared the veggie dumplings, and the split two vegetarian entree combos (butternut squash and mushrooms). the flavors were out of this world. we didnt request a heat, and they were spiced perfectly. we cleaned our plates. 

YOU. MUST. GO!
author: Jenny C.

description:
Excellent, attentive service. I appreciate being graciously allowed a substitution in the combo meal. 

I loved that the mango lassi wasn't too sweet, unlike some other south Asian spots.

Very good garlic naan--the garlic was fresh and the naan hearty. The eggplant curry had some really nice green onion, and the combo was substantial enough that I have plenty of food toward my next meal.
author: X-topher B.

description:
One of the best Nepalese food I've tried thus far. My husband wanted to take me on a date night and we couldn't decide where we wanted to dine we wanted something different that we both never ate. So I yelped a few different options and came across this little gem of a place, we decided to give it a go and let me tell you it was the best experience. Prem the owner is such a humble person, he goes above and beyond with service and hospitality. 

We tried various dishes like the Butternut squash Curry, Palak Paneer, Vegetarian and Chicken Momo's with tomato chili chutney (could be a little spicer) and the Nagala Sya a-Traditional Chicken Curry (DELICIOUS) with garlic naan and rice! Very pleased with the authentic flavor in each dish. 

Been here twice already, we took a few friends and family the second time around because they never had Nepalese food and they were very happy with the experience!!! Can't wait to go back. :)
author: Luv K.

description: My favorite Nepalese restaurant, and the best Veggie Momos I have ever had! Aside from the awesome food, the owner and staff are super nice and the service is excellent!  My husband and I feel at home whenever we go here.
author: Jessica O.

description:
Prem (the owner/chef) is absolutely lovely.  He greeted us when we arrived, and checked in on our table (as well as everyone else's) several times during our meal.  He's quite charming, a pleasure to talk to, and help makes a place like Cuisine of Nepal that much more comfortable and enjoyable.

His food, however, is amazing.  We split an order of the Kukhurako Ledo Chicken Cashew Cream Curry & the Poleko Khasi Sizzling Lamb Platter.  Both were delicious and prepared with love and care.  I do suggest ordering them both as combos, which includes lentils, naan, rice, and a delicious vegetable mix.

Go here.  Eat here.  Tell your good friends (but not too many, because we still need to be able to get tables!).

Thank you Prem!
author: Cj L.

description: The best Nepali food outside of Nepal! The dumplings are to die for. First time I tried thali food there and it was great. So many options all good.
author: Bison U.

description: Cuisine of Napal is a small, clean and quiet restaurant. I ordered my food to go. The server was very friendly. While I waited, I used the restroom. It wasn't the nicest or cleanest. They offered tea and water while we waited. They had pleasant, relaxing music playing in the restaurant. The service is fast and the food is very good. Try the palak paneer with garlic naan. It's tasty. I would eat here again and would definitely recommend this place.
author: Lynn S.

description:
Didn't think it would live up to the hype but I gotta say this place is pretty great. I haven't had nepalese food before so the flavors were very unique to me. Pork Momos and Lamb Kebab were solid. Highlight was the house special chicken curry dish. I would've dipped my butter naan in that sauce all day if I didn't run out of naan. Chicken was falling off the bone and oh-so tender.

Chef was super friendly and asked us about the food. He was worried it might have been too spicy (warning: everything is a little spicy so if you can't handle spice at all, this place is probably not for you) and even offered a little sweet dessert to our friend who looked like she was overloaded on spice. All in all, a great experience! Not too crowded on a late Saturday night.
author: Clinton L.

description:
Any establishment that gives me wine as soon as I walk in the door is A-okay in my book.

In all seriousness though, this restaurant is a real gem. And the owner - Prem - is a huge part of it. 

It's a small intimate place so all the tables were taken up at first. Prem sat us in some nice plush chairs, gave us each a glass of red or white wine and then apologized for the "wait". We were seated in less than 10 minutes so I really don't know what "wait" he was talking about.

We split an order of pork momos and each ordered the Chicken Cashew Cream Curry for our entree. The pork momos are solid - it's really hard to hate on any culture's version of dumplings. As for the chicken curry, I always try and order what the restaurant is known for the first time. And boy do I get why people rave about this dish. The texture is buttery smooth and the chicken is sweet and flavorful. Pro-tip: if you're a big fan of na'an, ask them to substitute the rice that comes with the dish with more servings of na'an. 

The best part though was Prem. He kept coming back and checking up on us to see how we were doing and was very diligent about making sure our wine glasses weren't empty. If you get a chance to talk to him, his story is a fascinating one. Before he was a cook here in SF, he worked in Nepal as a sherpa, acting as a hired guide to help foreigners and American tourists hike up Mount Everest. So he REGULARLY scaled one of the toughest mountains to climb in the world. 

We stayed until closing time and Prem never pressured us to leave. At the very end of the meal, when we got the bill, he came up and checked the bill and said to us, "I just want to make sure that he didn't charge you for the wine."

PREM - YOU ARE THE MAN! 

If you're a fan of Nepalese food, definitely come to Cuisine of Nepal. But more so, come just to meet Prem.
author: Anna W.

description: I came here with my fiancée after it was featured as a neighborhood hot spot. The food and service were top notch. We ordered the platter for 2 people and what showed up was a mountain of delicious food. The husband-and-wife owners came by our table several times to check on us and make sure we were enjoying everything. Super nice people. The bamboo shoot curry and egg curry were our favorites. The dumplings were unique and really tasty. And we slathered everything with their amazing sesame chutney. So good! We'll be coming back here a lot.
author: Shawn S.

description:
good hotel
sdfsddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd

dsfsfsfsdfsd
sdfsdfsdf
ewrwer
author: John J.

description: Really good food and great curries. I lived for over 5 years in London where good curry abounds, so was so happy that Cuisine of Nepal was in our neighborhood! Owner and staff are awesome. Will come back to try more dishes!!
author: Genesis L.

description: Wow.... this place is amazing! The owner was the sweetest guy ever.. he made you feel like you were family! He offered us more wine and made substitutions for us I our meal without a problem! He even offered to take our order before sitting down because we had been waiting for a while!  The food was delicious! We started with the Samosa.. and I thought it can't get better than this.. but it did! The orange chutney was exquisite! The flavors were invigorating! We're coming back to try other plates in the menu! LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Gaby C.

description: The food here is amazing! It is the most similar to Nepali food from Nepal that I've found in the bay area, and we've been on quite a search. I ordered the palak paneer and although it was a bit spicy for me was so good I couldn't stop eating it. It used more the Nepali style spicing, meaning lots of cumin seed (my favorite), even though it's traditionally an Indian dish. The waiter even checked in with the spiciness and when I told him it was a bit hot for me he offered to take it back and they made me a whole new dish milder, it was perfect then. Naan was delicious! My husband who is from Nepal and also loved his chicken radish curry combo.
author: Allison S.

description:
Another fantastic Bernal restaurant!  Had some friends stop by at the last minute and decided to go try out Chef Prem's new place. Its located right where Cortland meets Mission St. which is not exactly easy to spot passing by. His food is better than ever, and he's very proud of it. We were all eager to try each other's food because it all looked and smelled so wonderful. 
To begin with we ordered Momo's, Samosa's (both vegie and lamb), and Mismasas appetizers.  They arrived and were generous proportions. We could have made a meal on these alone.  Everything was fresh and cooked to perfection. 
The entrees were equally as satisfying.    We ordered -Kukhurako Ledo - chicken in a yummy cream curry, Poleko Jhinge Machha, a Sizzling Prawn Platter, nice and spicy, and the Poleko Khasi, a Sizzling Lamb Platter. There was plenty of food in these 3 meals for all 5 of us to share.  

The food and the service were outstanding. Chef Prem and his staff are warm and hospitable.  I just wish I was better at writing reviews because this place deserved one better than I am able to write.
author: Chris G.

description: The owner and executive chef greeted us at the door, extremely welcoming and polite man. The service by him and his staff was impeccable and always on time. They even offered a complimentary glass of wine! The food was out of this world!! Ordered pork dumplings, a chicken curry or sorts and seared lamb(don't know exact item). The plating and taste was amazing. 5/5, would eat here weekly if I could.
author: Nicholas B.

description: Not too bad first time here we got seated is a long day out celebrating and I. We just grab a bite before we go home Foods OK I mean I haven't tried everything but I guess I'll come back and try that next thing on the menu other than that service great if we stopped and it taste good hope you guys have a good evening and be safe out there
author: Miko A.

description:
Just had dinner here. Our meal was outstanding and the service was fantastic. Their signature dish, the cashew cream curry chicken, is a delicious alternative to our usual boring Indian food order of chicken Tikka Masala. The Himalayan Momo dumplings are similar to pot stickers, but they are steamed and come with a delicious spicy sesame sauce.

Chef/owner Prem Tamang is genuine, modest and gracious. He engaged us in a great conversation and made sure everything was perfect.

Inexpensive and delicious ethnic cuisine served in a friendly atmosphere is very rare in today's SF foodie restaurant culture. I'm glad we found that rare experience right her at Cusine of Nepal.
author: Dan C.

description:
A friend of mine turned me onto this place when I was visiting--I wish I could eat like this everyday! I love Nepalese dishes because it is savory, balanced, and makes my body feel happy (not happy from a side effect from the MSG, they don't use it here). I wanted to eat here everyday but my friends said I had to roam the foodie highway while in SF. I ordered the Pharsi, and Chana Saag. I cannot eat gluten but I luckily had my gluten aid caps with me to help me stave off some of the side effects and did eat the butter naan. 

I will be back again when I land in SF. Thank you to the chef, and owners for such a wonderful experience
author: Ally N.

description: Great and friendly service. The food was delicious and plentiful and the place smelled amazing. I'm so pleased my friends introduced me to this place. I don't eat out often, but I'll be back.
author: Da V.

description: I was really excited to find a Nepalese restaurant so close to me. But a disappointment. Most importantly their momos suck!!! They are needlessly pricey, the service is okay. The tea sucks too. However, the cashew chicken was good, and the lamb tandoori dish was good. Chicken chowmein is bland. Gave them multiple tries trying to like them, but I failed.
author: Priyanka S.

description: Delicious food and a fantastic staff to complement it. Chef Prem Tamag serves up healthy and authentic meals that are finger licking good. We tried the palak paneer & prawn curry and highly recommend both.
author: Dinesh S.

description: Delicious food!  The chicken curry dish is the perfect amount of spice and the naan is perfectly baked.  Make it a combo for the perfect homely meal feel. The waiting staff is also friendly and attentive. First time here visiting from l.a. and will definitely recommend to anyone living here or stopping by for a visit.
author: Sarah R.

description: Great veggie options.  Ordered a few great starters and two curries.  Parents and kids are all happy, full, and duly impressed.
author: Tascha F.

description:
I've only been once, but I'll definitely be back. Seems like a great little spot here, squeezed in tight -- I'd call it a hole in the wall, except that it's very fresh and modern (though compact).

The star is the delicious food. We got the dinner for two -- everything was prepared perfectly: flavored well, cooked just to the right level (even challenging dishes to get different ingredients all cooked just right).
author: Frank J.

description: Amazing food, quick service, great selection!   Very flavorful meal with a fun, upbeat environment.  Definitely will be back!
author: Katrina F.

description: Food is excellent and plentiful. We ordered several dishes and were happy with the lot. The lamb keema curry and chicken saag curry were particular standouts.
author: Avinash K.

description: Amazing food in a really cosy and homely restaurant. The portions (food and wine) were generous and all the food was freshly prepared. The chef and owner Prem is really kind and hospitable who even packed us a box of his chutney (just because we asked him how he makes it). Will definitely be back for more !
author: Eshita S.

description: So good! The Salmon sizzling platter was cooked to perfection came to our table piping hot. Samosas were large, moist and very tasty. Cashew chicken and saag paneer were excellent -- a little lighter than you might be used to with Indian food. Family-run, storefront in the outer mission. Eat here!
author: Sheviche R.

description: I have eaten here plenty of times and am just now getting around to writing a review. I have never had anything here that wasn't delicious. And the service is fantastic. I booked a table for 8 here for my birthday (which is a pretty big table for how small the restaurant is). When we showed up we were greeted by the owner who told us that a new employee had screwed up and seated people at our table. He was very kind and apologized profusely, assured us he would get us a table asap, and promised us free unlimited drinks. Both of those promises were fulfilled, and our group ended up having a great evening.
author: Maggie J T.

description: What a cute place albeit small, the staff and chef are super sweet and nice. The food is delicious I'm not sure what I had but everything I had was delicious. I get that home vibe... Home cooked meal it was so comforting I ended staying there for a couple hours with good company.
author: Farrah F.

description:
Came here for the grand opening and tried several dishes for just $5! Regular prices are around $15-$18 per dish. 

My favorite is definitely the chicken cashew cream curry, reminiscent of a flavorful tikka masala without the layer of grease you see at some Indian restaurants.

Also loved topping my curry with vegetable fritters to add some crunch.

The naan here had an amazing chewy texture that is addicting.

Service was warm and attentive, like walking in to your auntie's house.

All in all a great experience and would come back again to dine in or for takeout.
author: Catherine C.

description: Best Nepalese food in the city. The service is amazing and the food was even better.  You should definitely get the set menu platter for 2.  The black-eyed peas with bamboo shoots was delicious and the samosas were perfect.  I'm definitely coming back here for the egg and spinach curry!
author: Melanie O.

description:
I cannot possibly say enough good things about this place. The food is phenomenal, the service is attentive and the staff are so personal. 
We brought a 2 year old and the owner brought him a plate of food within 5 minutes- because he clearly knows all about toddlers. 
This is the best way to visit Nepal from SF!
author: D M.

description: The service, atmosphere, and food was BOMB DOT COM. Everyone should come here. They will give you wine on the house and treat you like family. One of the first restaurant I went to when I moved to Bernal Heights and it continues to be my favorite one.
author: Max N.

description: Unassuming interior but fantastically prepared food. It was my first time trying Nepalese and as someone who loves Indian food it was both novel and familiar - and very delicious. My lamb curry had fantastic flavor. The chef was walking around making sure everyone was enjoying their meal so I even got to ask him how he gets the lamb so tender. Excited to come back soon
author: Michael S.

description: The owner Pram was amazing and the food was sublime! Defiantly recommend to a friend and family!
author: Brian T.

description: I don't get the 5 star reviews. "The neighborhood favorite" chicken cashew cream curry had zero flavor, wayyyyyy too much cream and a tiny portion for the price - barely enough for one person. The Naan is undercooked, doughy and rubbery. The rice was just plain regular white rice and it was over cooked. Nothing special.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Super delicious! The lentil jhol soup was great, with subtle complicated spicing and just the right amount of caraway seeds to have an interesting texture. Momos big, tender, and very gingery. So many vegetarian options. I will be back to try everything!

It is amazing they managed to turn this hole-in-the-wall place (that used to have a doomed and slightly uncomfortable feeling) into a nice, cozy, cheerful place to eat and hang out.
author: Liz H.

description: First, the atmosphere of the restaurant was very nice. We came around 9:30 pm on Thursday night so it was not so busy. I ordered steamed dumplings and they were delicious. And lamb samosas were amazing as well. Then came the cashew curry chicken, which went really well with the nan and rice. Last but not least, mango lassi is not too sweet and tasted sooo good. I believe the owner, who came out a couple times to ask how the food was. The service is on point and re fills for water came several time. If you're looking for some good food to eat, I'd recommend this place!
author: Ye A.

description: Such a great dining experience. Honest, no frills space with amazingly high quality food. 10/10 on the flavor meter!
author: Ryen M.

description: I loved loved loved this place. I will recommend and tell everyone one about it. The chicken was so flavorful and the meat was so tender. I tried all of my friends' plates and they were all so delicious, excellent quality.   I tried the #10 spinach chicken combo. I think. To die for. Great service. One of the workers (probably owner) came up to us and talked to us for a bit and he was so sincere and kind. He told us a little bit about how he cooks the food. First time here and they left a great impression on me.
author: Gemma B.

description:
Delicious food and such a great owner - lovely family owned business!

We loved our meal and definitely plan to be back.
author: Lauren D.

description: Love this spot. Cashew chicken is amazing. Great service. Can't beat the combo meal with greasy naan. Great for takeout
author: Ashley K.

description: Pretty great but not quite fully epic in my humble opinion.  We had the popular chicken with cashew cream curry and it was pretty damn good; tender boneless chicken with a perfectly blended curry sauce that just begged to dipped in by some fresh butter naan (and that did in fact occur).  I would put it up there with some of the best chicken tikka masala dishes I've had so it's worth to go here just for this item.  The samosas we started with were pretty amazing too, both the veggie and minced lamb ones had a perfect crust and equally tasting fillings though quite different from one another. The fresh tamarind sauce wasn't needed but definitely added a whole other dimension.  So why not epic? Well the basil lamb curry was just so-so, like not bad but not great.  For 5 stars, you have to be epic all around.  Tough, huh? Well, there are more delicious things to try so maybe it will rise to 5 stars! I know you can't wait to see how this turns out, right? :)
author: Saminda W.

description:
I never had any Nepalese food before. 

This restaurant is so yummy. We are vegan and had the butternut squash dish and the eggplant dish. Both were so delicious. Our party also ordered some appetizers that were so good.  They ordered the veggie samosas and veggie dumplings. So yummy. We will definitely be coming here again. Can't wait to try more!
author: Reese E.

description: This place is insanely good, great service, great atmosphere. This is my go to spot at least a few times a week. I literally think about the food, all the time. Perfect place
author: Angeline P.

description: We had the chicken cashew curry and the butternut squash curry.  We started with the vege momos, which were nice.  The squash curry was inedible due to the very high salt level, which really surprised us since this type of food is so spicy and not in need of a lot of salt.  It was the same with the little cup of lentil soup.  The owner was kind enough to have another squash dish prepared, this time lacking the thick salty sauce.  Much better, but we both felt, after paying over $50, including a decent tip, that the experience was quite underwhelming.  This will be our last visit.
author: Alexandria B.

description:
Wow. Wow. Great!!!!
Originally wanted to go to the Chinese restaurant near and they were closed for construction and I'm just glad we had a chance to try this cozy spot. 

Their grand opening is on May 14th noon to 8pm. Make sure you will make it here for that and probably good idea to skip a meal the night before because they will offer you a plenty of food and so many things to try. 
The portion is super generous and I had a giant fat veggie momo. These giant momo babies are my favorite. 

Chinese mustard leaf sauté is very tasty. Lentil soup is exactly how I like it to be. 

And most of all, the service here is superb. Nicest people and we left here with happy belly and huge smile on our faces :)
author: K O.

description: Great food in a fun chaotic atmosphere. Very hearty portions with bold flavors. Try everything and find your own favorite.
author: Chester B.

description: The food is fantastic! We had the mixed grill and the butternut squash curry, both as a combo. The sides on the combo were awesome: tender curry vegetables, flavorful lentils, soft butter naan, and we loved that they have brown and basmati rice to choose from. The meat was really tender and flavorful and on a bed of peppers and onions that got browned and crispy by sitting on the hot plate, and the squash was so tender it fell apart when you cut it. The staff were very welcoming and attentive, and the owner went table by table to greet everyone and offer them a glass of wine on the house. The prices are very reasonable for the quantity and quality of food. Would highly recommend and will definitely be back!
author: Team K.

description: I haven't had the opportunity to dine it yet but I ordered chicken momos and they were delicious! Being new in San Francisco, this is the first Nepali restaurant that I tried and they deliver for free! I am definitely coming back to try more authentic nepali food of their menu.
author: Sagar G.

description: I should of known to be careful when I saw the highass rating coupled with this restaurant having an ad on the top of the yelp page. I ordered the sizzling shrimp plate for around 20 dollars and guess what I got? A grand total of five poorly seasoned dry shrimp. Get the fuck outta here. I'd rather swan dive into a cactus than eat at this shithole again. The mango lassi was good tho.
author: Edward H.

description:
THIS WAS SOME OF THE BEST FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD. This literally made my night bc my taste buds were dancing their asses off with delight after eating the kebab here!

I am a kebab fiend and usually don't like ordering it outside bc people tend to be so bad at spicing it right while serving it with the right amount of moisture. But not these people!!

Holy shit that was flavorful. Damn. I am soooo going to eat here again and again and again!
author: Mia F.

description: Awesome restaurant, great food, gracious owner with great service.  Sizzling platters (shrimp and chicken) were fantastic
author: Steve F.

description: Amazing food. And just fantastic hospitality! Thank you for making us feel so welcome. Today was the hottest day in sf in over fifty years - the owner personally came up to us and gave us a free class of wine! We are very touched. Can't recommend enough
author: Rick S.

description: Amazing food, surprisingly pleasant ambience. Highly recommend the salmon curry. The chef came over personally to ask how we liked the food. Doesn't look like much from the outside but it's a hidden gem.
author: Trini L.

description: I bookmarked it quite a while ago and finally went and it was a good idea! I went with a group and we all enjoyed (curries, mixed sizzling mix platter and kabobs). All were fantastic
author: Me M.

description: Overall great food, although their curry dishes and meat samosas tend to be a tad too salty. Excellent nan bread.
author: Inigo M.

description:
The food here is great; the staff is friendly; the space is nice (if a little cold).

 I'm sorry to break their streak of 5-star reviews, but I just felt like the price point was a little too high for lunch. I do wish these folks the best, and I hope they succeed.
author: Chris P.

description: Really good food. Not too expensive, but at absolutely zero sacrifice of the quality. Best food I know. The owner is very nice, and makes us want to come back every time. It's either Chinese food or Cuisine of Nepal for us. We won't go anywhere else, there is nowhere else in SF that matches the quality of this place.
author: Zane S.

description: The food was awesome. Service was excellent. The owner came out to personally ensure we were happy
author: Wathid A.

description: First off Prem Tamang was very friendly and a wonderful host!  But that was only the start.  My friend and I order The Nepalese Dinner for two and I thought we ate everything but more food came.   It was spicy, varied and delicious.  So many flavors - thank goodness I had the free glass of house wine that came with dinner.    The restaurant is small, I believe you can make with reservations, but more than worth the effort.
author: B M.

description: Food is extraordinary, service is friendly and down to earth. Already planning our next visit. Portions plentiful enough for a delicious dinner of leftovers that I will look forward to tomorrow night ! We had the cashew curry chicken , the basil curry lamb and the paneer, after the momo pork starter.
author: Gregg C.

description:
I was visiting San Fran a few weeks ago and got lost finding this place. I finally arrived after their lunch hours were over and the owner still let me in. He even gave me free wine while I waited for my food. I ordered a curry combo that came with sides of mixed vegetables, lentil soup and rice. The tofu in my curry was perfectly cooked. 

Prompt and friendly service. The decor of the restaurant was great.
author: Misghana A.

description: Excellent food. Excellent service thank you to Prem and his team! So much passion and flavor for the food! So much love for this place.
author: Jazzy G.

description:
After tonight's meal I feel like I'll be back for more in the future. 
I wouldn't leave a 5 star review unless I'm benefitting in some way but this place is 100% delicious!
author: Danny H.

description:
My husband and I ate dinner after work last week in the restaurant and it was so good. Exceeded expectations!  I lived in Nepal for 2 years and this is the best Nepali food I've had since returning in 2000.  Chicken momo were perfect.  The daal bhat was on point.  The mango lassi was great. 
The dining area is small but has a nice vibe.  I can see us eating take-out and dining in regularly.  
I've already alerted my Nepal-loving friend circle!  We will all be there at some point!
author: Michelle W.

description: Sooooooo good!!!! Very happy I found this place. Also bad because it's close to home.... Absolutely enjoyed everything I ate. I must go back SOON and try more from the menu. I checked out what everyone else was eating around me and it all looked amazing.
author: D D.

description: My husband and I dropped in on a whim for lunch today and had an incredible meal, and unlimited real- brewed masala chai to wash it all down. The owner was very friendly and provided wonderful, attentive, friendly service! The food was fresh and very tasty. Just the right amount of spice too! We will be back, thank you!
author: Jessica M.

description: came here for lunch. It was a nice restaurant, cozy and lovely. The service was good. I ordered a lamb kebab combo and the portion was huge. Food was excellent.
author: Chi C.

description: What a gem! We were out and about and were hungry for some great ethnic food. Found this small place on Yelp and so glad we did. My son had the vegetable combination and his wife and I split the lamb kebob combination. Plenty of food, perfectly cooked and reasonably priced (for San Francisco!). We hope to be back someday but we live in Fremont and are not in San Francisco too often.
author: Sidney W.

description: Excellent food. Everything was well cooked and the seasoning was on point. Somehow, despite being about 7 feet wide at the entrance (it's a very small place) they maintain a very good atmosphere. Maybe because it was packed - the night I came I could tell it was super busy. My food still arrived very promptly and the service was still warm and kind. I understand why this place has the rating it does now.
author: Kiril S.

description: Love this place! The chicken is amazing. The staff are friendly. One of my favorite places to eat in the bernal heights area. Get the cashew chicken. Samosas are also delicious!
author: Diana L.

description: I'm completely baffled by all the 5-star reviews here. I'd say 2 1/2 stars. It must be better when you eat at the restaurant. We just ordered delivery for the first time. The food was just fine, nothing was truly great and I'm not eager to order it again. It all seemed fresh, the samosas were very crispy, and nothing at all seems greasy or oily like so much take out can be. But, everything was just really truly bland. I mean really, REALLY bland. It was fine--but nothing 5-star about it. I will say the nan was awful--I threw it out.
author: Wendy G.

description: Probably the best food I have had in a while. The owner is really friendly! Good portion meals :)
author: Pratistha S.

description: If you are looking for great flavors, amazing hospitality ,friendly staff and overall superb experience, Cuisine of Nepal has got all that covered. This tiny ...little ..cozy place makes u feel amazing experience of decent authentic spices of nepalese....the price is affordable ..very excited to come back again..see u soon..
author: Kris T.

description: Very good food. We ordered takeout, it arrived only 10 mins later than the confirmed time but it was also a rainy evening! Couldn't be happier to find that the food is still hot.
author: Britta C.

description: All restaurants should be this nice!  When you come in they treat you like your a king and the food is absolutely delicious.  We started with the meat samosas and the dumplings.  Both came with delightful dipping sauces and then we had the sizzling lamb dinner.  Everything was really tasty, delicious and new.  The owner came out and said hello to everyone there and the waitstaff go out if their way to make you as happy as possible.  REALLY , all restaurants should be like this!
author: M. R.

description: Excellent service and food! Got a complimentary chai tea for waiting. Owners are super friendly
author: Amanda A.

description:
I came with my girlfriend who has been to Nepal.  We started with Chai tea, Momo's & Lamb Chhoila.  Our favorites where Chai Tea & Lamb Chhoila. Momo's were a bit over seasoned. 

Cashew nut chicken cream with garlic naan and brown rice was our main course was fantastic & my girlfriend liked it very much! The owner offered wine on the house. So, nice of him!Definitely, we will be back to this restaurant!!

Ambience was contemporary & relaxed with nice pictures of Nepali culture & landscapes. The owner was very hospitable!  They made our evening lovely.
author: Karan M.

description: First time having Nepalese and happy to have it here! Food was delicious and the service was delightful. The meal was full of flavor with the right amount of heat. Recommend: bottomless chai!
author: Sean R.

description: Prem (the owner and chef) is a delight. He lovingly attends to every single customer and makes every single customer feel special. Kids also adore him, and his interactions with them are very cute. The food was excellent! Will definitely go back.
author: Sonali C.

description: Great Indian food! Must get the cashew chicken curry. The family combos are also very generous as well. For SAn Francisco it pretty affordable in terms of Indian food. The A La Carte dishes includes rice and Naan which is great.
author: Max M.

description: I have to add to the 5* crowd by saying that i don't usually like tofu, but we had a tofu with green bean curry here that was so silky and smooth i may just be a convert! We also samples the cashew chicken curry that has a unique almost cheesy flavor.. amazing! Service here was also top notch with both our waiter and the owner being very attentive despite how incredibly busy the restaurant was. Because of the recent explosion in popularity of this small fantastic restaurant the wait for a table might be long but is totally worth it.
author: Raphael P.

description:
Holy cow. We went to Cuisine of Nepal for my partner's birthday and it was one of the best meals we've ever had (for some of the most affordable prices in SF!). The restaurant is really cozy and small, but beautifully decorated. We got the butternut squash curry (~$16) and the salmon sizzler plate (~$19) combos. The perfect amount of food for two people to share with just a small bit leftover. It was nice to each have our own rice, naan, veggies, lentils, and chutney rather than sharing them. The salmon was served as fajitas in Mexican restaurants are -- sizzling on a cast iron dish. Perfectly cooked, though could have used a bit more spice (we requested hot for both our dishes.). The chef came out midway through the meal and made sure our meal was great, otherwise he "would fix it!" We left full, satisfied, and glad to give our money to a restaurant that has such incredible service. 

Please go! Support this awesome place.
author: Mike G.

description: Loved this place for dinner. The restaurant itself is very cozy, and the food was incredible. The head chef was very kind and checking in on all of the tables to make sure everyone was enjoying their food. I will definitely be back.
author: Na Z.

description: The service was so lovely! The owner is very hospitable, the atmosphere is cozy & the food is great. The chicken cashew curry is decent but the lamb is off the hook! Definitely coming back to this place.
author: Ellen M.

description: Tasty and spicy food and fresh ingredients. Good attention. I would go back there if I lived in SF.
author: Daniel S.

description: Went here for lunch the bf. Good, friendly service, but the food was just ok. The chicken cashew curry was pretty good, but it felt a bit heavy and it was missing that "umph". Everything else (vegetable dumpling, naan, bread, lentils, vegetable side dish, mango shake) was mediocre. It was pretty pricey too. I love Indian/Pakistani food, so maybe my flavor palate was just looking for more.
author: Lioness C.

description: We tried this place last week and wanted to Yelp them.  We had a great dinner...the food was great (especially the momos!), and the staff and owner were especially gracious.  Definitely enjoyed our meal here and loved the family-owned vibe.  We'll be back!
author: Jesus H.

description: Amazing food and service. We got traditional chicken curry and spinach and cheese. The owner served us and we're so sweet. One of our favorite restaurants in the city.
author: J. N.

description: Walked in with my two children (5 & 3)...immediately the owner hooked them up with a curry chicken dish...an absolute smash!!! We are hooked!
author: Jason S.

description:
Been here 2x since moved me to Bernal Heights. Over all great food! 

The owner is a doll, but his servers aren't real concerned with service. So don't expect great service, you'll have to be a little pushy, but the food makes up for it.
