I forget what I have the first time but it was a 10 out of 10! my second trip was still good, but the main dish I ordered (tofu tarkari) because someone on yelp said it was good. I think she was raised on sugarless oatmeal, cause this lacked the flavor I had the first time. If you don't want spicy, this is the dish for you. You'll be fine :). 

I wish i could remember what i had the first time?!? Anyway just GO!
author: Rocky R.

description: AWESOME food and very hospitable owner and staff - best curry in town and definitely 5 stars!
author: Nadine B.

description:
The owner was really nice and attentive. 

We were in a hurry since we were headed to the airport after lunch but I just wanted to try out Nepalese food since we don't really have it in Texas. 

We ordered:
- pork momos- can't go wrong with any type of dumplings. Looks like a chinese dumpling but it's filling is Indian-y with a nice curry like sauce.
- spinach chicken curry (Kukhura Ra Saagko Tarkari) - ordered it because it looked so appealing on the menu. It wasn't a let down. If you wanted to make sure you had your vegetable serving for the day, get this. Lots and lots of spinach. I enjoyed it. It reminded me of palak paneer with chicken curry.

I wish we came with more people so we could try some other dishes. My friend was raving about the chow mein,
author: Nancy N.

description: The momos, and chaumin were excellent. Good portions...enough for take home too. Would eat there again.
author: Tushar P.

description:
I had a fantastic experience here with my girlfriend after work on a Wednesday night, and cannot overstate how great the experience was. 

Service: The waiters and even owner of cuisine of Nepal were extremely friendly. They went out of their way to provide us with refills, sides, and menu recommendations. Far from pushy, the owner actually recommended we not order more than we did, which I've never experienced. 

Food: The food was very reasonably priced. A dinner set for two was $48, and included two beers, a mountain of appetizers (samosas, a cubed meat dish, and momos), a bamboo shoot based curry, naans, rice, more dipping sauces...needless to say, I was stuffed by the time the entrees even arrived. I took home more than half of the food I ordered, and I'm a big eater who can demolish two Chipotle burritos in one sitting. 

Atmosphere: the place is charming, with seating for about 30. I wish there were some ambient music, but the place was lively and never felt dull. 

Please give this place a try. I know that I will be coming back.
author: Larmon L.

description:
I was wanting to try this place for a while now, and today was the day. The person who seated us seemed a bit annoyed that we didn't want to sit right by the door (it was early and the place was still empty), but the man and woman who served us our wonderful meal were both very friendly and helpful. The owner also came by to see if everything was to our liking ("yes!").

We had the pork momos - excellent dumplings with a just-right spicy sauce - for an appetizer. These are a must have. Next up was the chicken kebab, which were excellent and not really spicy as some reviewers said, but very moist and tasty. Will definitely order again. We had the sizzling lamb, which was good and definitely sizzling. If you like your lamb rare like we do, move the meat to a different plate right away or it will keep cooking on the sizzling platter. We also liked the squash curry dish and will definitely order that again. 

We normally order dishes a la carte, but here it makes sense to get the "combo" option with at least one or two of your dishes. In addition to the usual rice, you get naan, vegetable curry and lentils, plus some of the excellent sauce that comes with the momos. One member of my group commented that, unlike many east Asian places, they don't ask if you want your food mild, medium, or hot. We all agreed that when the chef really knows what he's doing, they don't need to ask. That is certainly the case here; we look forward to coming back!
author: Meredith S.

description: They were so ridiculously kid friendly. The owner and workers not only come out to greet the kids personally, but they also brought out two huge samosas that we didn't even order, since they knew that my daughter was hungry. For free! And they gave her extra rice and naan. The kid at the table next to us was eating his small plate of free food while the dad waited for the order too. Crazy good customer service. At the end, he asked my kid directly if she wanted more naan haha. I swear it felt like I was at family's house with the way they doted on the kids. So loving! We got there at 5:15 and was empty. But within 15 mins they were packed.  Food is delicious.  The butternut squash dish is so good!  We ordered one combo and momos and still had leftovers to take home.
author: Nisha K.

description: Fantastic little place! They layout is interesting and we almost missed the spot walking by! Inside is so cozy and as soon as you walk in you smell the delicious food! The staff were so incredibly nice and friendly. We did the combo for 4 people and it was absolutely delicious. The fried black bean appetizer was amazing, the chicken was incredible... everything was delicious and the overall vibe and atmosphere really made the night for our group of three. We will absolutely be back!
author: Alma A.

description: Had the meal for 2 and were extremely satisfied. The lamp was tasty and the chicken juicy.
author: Nerses O.

description: This has been an absolutely wonderful experience.  First welcomed by the owner and then served a most delicious meal.  Each item was fresh and expertly prepared. Highly recommend and will definitely return.  Will be bringing friends along with me too.  Word of advise...plan on lunch time eating or early dinner.  Must be packed at dinner time.
author: Tara E.

description: My daughter and I tried it and loved it.   The service was fantastic.  The lamb was seasoned and cooked very well.
author: Lawrence T.

description: I visited cuisine of Nepal for the first time with a friend. We ordered basil lamb curry and chicken kebab as our main dishes, and the golden pockets for appetizer. All of them tasted great! In addition, the customer service was terrific that 1) the owner of the restaurant greeted customers warmly 2) servers attend to customers friendly and fast.
author: Sara Z.

description:
I agree with all the great reviews this restaurant has. The food is full of flavor. The place is cozy and well put together. 
The staff is so kind and polite.
I highly recommend this place and will come back for sure.
author: L. K.

description: The food was delicious and the service is prompt and warm. We had samosas, the wontons, and several curries. Will come back when we are in town again.
author: Paolo M.

description: What a find! Absolutely delicious food - the butternut squash curry was outstanding, and the lamb was especially yummy (it marinates overnight in yogurt, olive oil, lemon & spices). Most of all, the chef/owner and staff were so incredibly friendly and helpful, and made it feel like we were in their home. I'll definitely visit again soon!
author: Derya R.

description: So ridiculously delicious.  We came here after a calamity of air travel.  We rolled in 10 minutes before they closed.  It was still bustling and they were so welcoming.  The food...right.  Some of the best Indian Nepalese food that I have ever had.  Come here and then come again.  You will not be dissapointed.
author: Nate S.

description: Perfect mix of quintessential San Francisco small restaurant and ethnically authentic food. The owners served the food with the friendliest of smiles! Try the mango smoothie to start and rice pudding to finish!
author: Stephanie B.

description: This is one of the first Yelp reviews I've ever written and I feel compelled to share it based on the sheer quality of the food, which is beyond delectable and also incredibly balanced and culinarily nuanced. If that weren't enough, the owner-chef is a gem, something like an example of the American dream and a warm host who has done everything from bring free appetizers to keep his dining room open late on a cold night for straggling diners. You should definitely eat here tonight!
author: Shahid B.

description: Everything we got here was exceptional! We got 3 currys and well the meats were good the sauces were fantastic, so was the butter naan. Definitely can't wait to come here again!!
author: Ben E.

description: This is a hole in the wall type restaurant but with amazing food the service staff was really nice. I have to say it again - I enjoyed the food immensely.
author: Alex S.

description: THE SAAG TARKARI WAS AMAZING.  Seriously, it was so delicious. Just the right balance of sauteed but not mushy nor crunchy.  Salty but not too much. Their buttered naan was soft and moist.  I ordered a butternut squash curry also, which was...okay.  It was tasty, but could have been saltier.  The service was fantastic, and I will definitely go back.  It was pricey, but the chef is just really great at what he does, the food was authentic, and I hope they will be in the neighborhood for long time.
author: Wendy S.

description:
I went here with 5 friends for a birthday dinner. The service here was unlike any restaurant service I've experienced in SF. The owner told us fascinating stories, kept us laughing and happy, and made sure everything was perfect in every way.

The delicious food was just the cherry on top of the cake. So good!!!! Amazing vegetarian options aS well.

I will definitely be back!
author: Sarah B.

description: Looks a little low quality from the outside but the food is a amazing. The decor and lighting make it seem like a bad restaurant. But once you enter you notice the service is great and the food is high quality. Good selection of beer and different meats and veggie dishes. Try the lamb. It's really good! The price isn't too bad either.
author: Wesley M.

description: Wholesome Nepali / North Indian cuisine.  Great service and delicious food.  Perfect health score ... 100!
author: J B.

description: If you want to try some authentic Nepali food, then you shouldn't miss this place. I am myself from Nepal and was very pleased to find a place with such wonderful staff and authentic Nepali food.
author: Diwas T.

description: Incredible food, especially the cashew chicken (I think that's what it was.) and wash it down with a big bottle of Taj Mahal!
author: Joe H.

description: Delicious food, relaxed atmosphere, attentive service. Flavors are quite unique, and I have had a lot of awesome Indian and South Asian food that my girlfriend had introduced me to. Will be coming back for sure.
author: Anton S.

description: Very delicious food! Chef Prem is very hospitable. The chicken cashew curry is definitely a neighborhood favorite. So yummy! I also had the lamb samosas and the mixed grill. It was all so delicious. I will definitely come back.
author: Wendy L.

description: Loved the owner, he was AMAZING and super generous, even offered us some free wine with our dinner! Food was so very good, if you get spicy it can get pretty hot so be warned!
author: Dale C.

description: The flavor of food from here takes me back to my Motherland. If you are looking for authentic Nepali food unlike places where they say nepali and sell indian food than this is the place in San Francisco.
author: Sagar R.

description: Food is good overall and service is 5-star. We visited here for lunch along with parents and two little ones. The place is a bit tight but thats to be expected for most off the grid good restaurants in the city. Service was fast, attentive and interactive. We ordered basil lamb curry (ok), traditional chicken curry(excellent) and chana saag (good). Before that we ordered their famous momos and while veggie dumplings were ok, the chicken dumplings and the chutney did not disappoint. The only feedback - I think the food was not authentic Nepalese and mostly Indian or some what toned down and safer choices. It would be nice to add some strictly Nepalese dishes or "bhojan" combos to really promote the awesome himalayan cuisine.
author: Vipul B.

description: This place was our go to on Cortland. I was so bummed to hear their lease wasn't renewed. But every cloud has a silver lining...dare I say it's better than before? This place kicked into high gear delivering the most flavorful delicious food with top notch service! Awesome job - congrats on a great spot. Can't wait to come back.
author: rhiannon B.

description: Great food and the owner came by to speak with us personally. Really nice guy who takes pride in his food, customer service and overall atmosphere. The butternut squash dish was fantastic!!! We will be back!
author: shannon a.

description: Amazing food and great service! The people working are very welcoming and extremely friSuch an awesome little spot so glad to have this restaurant in the neighborhood! 2 thumbs up and 5 stars no doubt.
author: Margot F.

description: Forget dim sum, it's all about the momos. Momos are Nepali dumplings that are served with a delicious sauce called achar, which is basically crack with spices. Once I  had homemade momos and I've been dreaming of those little morsels ever since.  In my travels around the nation, if I hear there's a Nepali restaurant in town, I've made it a point to stop in and see if I could get my hands on some momos, but from restaurants in D.C. to Wisconsin, and even South Dakota, I could not find momos that came close to those delicious homemade momos. I even got the recipe from a Nepali woman and still could not replicate the amazingness of those homemade momos. However, my search for the ultimate  momos ended at Cuisine of Nepal. OMG. You guys need to get your butt down here and eat some momos. They nailed it. The secret sauce to great momos is literally the sauce (aka achar) that's served on the side and at Cuisine of Nepal the achar is just right - it's the right balance of flavors, spices, acidity, and texture. We tried other dishes here and they were all SO GOOD. The portions are huge. We had plenty of leftovers for dinner the next day  . The owner walks around and serves everyone and he is so kind. It's clear that he takes a lot of pride in his work. Enough gushing - just stop in. It's worth it!
author: Alison H.

description: While visiting San Francisco, I found this place on Yelp & couldn't wait to try it from seeing all the positive reviews!! Unfortunately when we called at 8:00pm, they said they were booked solid & for us to call back later. We ended getting there right before closing (10pm), yet they told us to take our time & stay as long as we wanted. The owner was SOOO nice to us, we have NEVER been treated so well at a restaurant or any other retail establishment. Even though it was closing time, the employees/owner patiently answered all our questions & gave us recommendations. We ended up getting the meat & seafood platter, as well as the spicy chicken plate & it was delicious!! Like others have said, it had just the right amount of spice & seasoning.They even gave us a few free drinks to try & the wine/chai tea were both great. The best part was they fed their family & employees at the end, so we felt like we were eating among them as if in their home (like family), not just patrons. Thank you for giving us such a memorable dining experience, we will be back anytime we're in town & will tell all our family & friends!!
author: Arthur C.

description: So, we were absolutely blown away by our dining experience at Cuisine of Nepal. My best friend and I were coming from the Miami for a visit to San Francisco and were starving and looking for a something healthy and delicious and we did a yelp search and we came across this gem. The energy and loving nature of the owners set the tone for one of the most amazing meals I have had within the states in a very long time. By far rivals the best Indian cuisine my friend I have experienced. Come here you will be beyond please. Kumari and her husband welcome you to this restaurant as if they open the doors to their home inviting good friends for a meal. Can't ask for more of an amazing time.
author: Katia P.

description: Wonderful food in a cozy setting. Great service, amazing favors - I'm so happy this opened in the neighborhood! We had the polekho kukkhura and the palak paneer, both extra hot. I love that the heat doesn't overpower the flavors here; the spices are just perfect. Definitely try the rice pudding for dessert!
author: Anne D.

description:
Lovely gem. 
Savory and spicy aromas immediately alert you to the treats to come. We had the butternut squash curry and the basil lamb curry, both were excellent, my husband found the curry lamb a little spicy, but in all fairness he forgot to tell the waiter his preference.  The kind  and charming owner brought us some homemade yogurt which  made the dish perfect.Do not miss getting the combo, for $2 00 it was a great value. We couldn't help noticing other customers enthusiastically complimenting the staff on their meals.
We will return.
author: Lynn R.

description: Incredibly attentive service and delicious food. We were a party of 5 and we ordered the set menu for 4 and we had left overs. Looking forward to trying the rest of the menu!
author: Miranda J.

description: Went there for first time this evening.  My parents have owned restaurants, so I have a great appreciation for owners that individually greet guests. The butternut curry and mushroom curry were delicious. Prem the owner came over checked on us through the meal and was delightful to chat with. Delicious vegetarian options and great atmosphere. Highly recommend checking it out.
author: An P.

description:
What a fun evening! We decided to find a Nepalese restaurant since our daughter is in Nepal
trekking.
The food was delicious! Chef Prem Tamang and his wife are charming. We even met their son
who was home for the holiday, from Grad School.
We can't wait to go back and bring our daughter when she returns next year.
I am going recommend this restaurant to my friends!
Thank you for such a wonderful meal!
author: J N.

description: It's in an unassuming little space but I was pleasantly surprised to find out that it's probably the best restaurant in the neighborhood. Very bold flavors, great kebabs, and whatever's in that orange sauce is amazing. They gave us three containers of it with take out and I've been putting it on everything. Since I live around the corner I hope they are there for a long time!
author: Vic W.

description: Brand new nepalese restaurant on Mission at the cross-section of Bernal Heights, Glen Park and the Mission. The food is stellar- flavorful, unique and hearty! You can tell that love and care goes into each dish and the neighborhood vibe makes you want to become a regular. The Kukhura Ra Khursani · Chili Chicken is delicious and we ordered the Poleko Khasi · Sizzling Lamb Platter spicy and it was flavored to perfection. We can't wait to go back and try out all the other dishes on the menu. Chef Prem is such a wonderful host and we enjoyed our meal almost as much as we loved chatting with Prem and hearing about his stories of growing up in Nepal. Highly recommend checking out this new neighborhood gem! We're already planning our trip back!
author: Sarah R.

description:
What an incredibly delightful restaurant with absolutely scrumptious food! The waitstaff was extremely helpful and attentive. And the owner/chef came out a number of times to check on us and ask how we liked our food. My boyfriend ordered our meal spicy against my protests. it was too spicy for me because I'm a wimp). To my surprise, the owner noticed my face and very kindly brought out a more mild version of the same dish AND some rice pudding to cool our palettes. How incredibly generous and thoughtful. Our dishes (butternut squash curry and mixed sizzling platter) were extremely well seasoned and delicious. Definitely prepared with love. Naan was tasty and so were the sides (highly recommend you ordering the full meal--well worth it). Good value too. 

We will definitely be back and highly encourage others to try it. It's neighborhood spots like these that make living and dining in San Francisco a pleasure, and it's up to people like us to keep them going. Go to Cuisine of Nepal now!
author: Eva S.

description:
Been here twice and each time was just great! 
The first time we ordered the set meal for 2 and then on our second visit we ordered the set meal for 4. I was in a daze as we were eating, it was that good! The dumplings and the samosas were great appetizers and my favorite dish was the curry with black eyed peas and bamboo. The staff was super friendly and I have to give them credit on their use of the small space. The bench that goes along the wall is new (previous restaurant did not have this) and utilizes the limited space very well. I do look forward to coming back here soon!
author: A K.

description: Yummy food and generous portions! Went there with a friend and we both liked our dishes. We weren't sure what to order so we just let our server suggest dishes for us and they came out great. Many vegetarian options there. We will go again, and also happy to know that they deliver too.
author: Mei L.

description: Amazing restaurant !! I came to eat mono n and didn't get a seat and have to wait for a long time . It was worth it . Viva Nepal!!!
author: Robert J.

description: Great food in this little family owned restaurant! We got the cashew curry chicken.  Very nice and creamy but not  overwhelming. The combo sizzling plate is of Salmon , lamb and chicken was ok. The lamb was too chewy n too plain.  The owners are very nice and personally comes around the table to make sure everything is good. Will be coming back!
author: Linh G.

description: I cannot recommend this place enough. The aroma of the tandoor hits you as soon as you walk in. The menu is as authentic as it gets. I recommend getting a combo, so you can experience a "Thali" or platter of rice, bread, lentils and veggies along with your main entree. The staff is really friendly, and it feels like a slice of Nepal in the middle of the Bay Area.
author: Parth B.

description: Excellent food, great place, outstanding menu and service! Executive Chef & owner Prem Tamang will greet you and welcome you just like the beautiful people of Nepal will welcome you to their homes! Wait no more and grab lunch or dinner at Cuisine of Nepal!
author: Yanira L. A.

description: I love the food here and the true neighborhood/family vibe Chef Pram presents.  He greeted us and chatted with us about the food which was super cool.  I especially enjoyed the curried squash and the dumplings.  The roasted tomato chutney sauce is amazing and I dipped everything I ate in it.  Happy to have the restaurant close to my neck of the woods!
author: Jaime F.

description: One of our friends recommended this place, and it didn't disappoint. The service was amazing, very welcoming and homely. We ordered mutton curry combo - we loved the curry - it wasn't the usual onion tomato paste that we find in almost all south asian places. The dal and veg curry with the combo were really yumm. . We are definitely coming back for more!
author: I Love Good Foo D.

description: As others have said, the food here is cooked quite close to perfect, the owner really tries hard to make the experience more human, and the place is well decorated.  San Francisco restaurants in general are only OKish by Chicago/New York/etc standards.  If only more places could be like this.  Wine selection could use a few more nice choices.  I'll be back soon.
author: Matt V.

description: My favorite restaurant in San Francisco.. Besides the food being beyond amazing (Nepalese food has a style and flavor similar to Indian food you've probably had, but this place takes the flavor to a whole new level of awesomeness) the staff are some of the most genuine and coolest folks I've ever met.  The owner comes to your table and hooks you up any chance he gets, the type of guy to comp your drinks or your appetizer simply because he feels like it.  I feel welcome and at home every time I come here, the type of vibe you might get going to eat dinner at your cool grandma's house.  Highly recommended and any chance I can get to help this business thrive I will take it, because it's just THAT GOOD!  P.s. (for vegetarians get the Saag Paneer combo plate, for meat eaters try the cashew curry butter chicken, Thank me later ;)
author: Allen W.

description: The food and service are both incredible. The owner stopped by our table to chat and even gave us a complimentary glass of wine. We got the minced lamb curry and chicken cashew cream curry. Both were fantastic!! This place is now on our go-to places in the neighborhood.
author: Julia M.

description: We came upon this delicious spot one night in the mission...sauces were sublime. chef was kind and offered rice pudding. What a find! will definitely be back. Most friendly and chill environment. The chicken kukuraku ledo was amazing!
author: C. C.

description: Excellent Nepal foods, except for the Cremini Mushrooms too salty. The Momo is OK, nothing special if u eat dumplings from other Chinese restaurant before. The lentils side dish was good. Nice change from the other Indian restaurants that we normally go. Will come back again.
author: Melvon M.

description: Such delicious Nepali food! Also the staff are so friendly and welcoming, we will definitely come back! Having a spent time in Nepal, the Sunde chicken curry tastes like homemade. Amazing!
author: Miriam W.

description:
A friend and I stopped for dinner here before an event that was happening nearby. We were greeted very warmly by the staff, and felt very welcome (even though we were awkwardly early for dinner and there weren't a lot of others there yet). 

The waiter was super friendly in helping me find something to eat despite my allergies and food restrictions, and the owner himself came out to check on us and make sure we had everything we needed. My friend enjoyed the wine they offered, and I had some chai which was very yummy (though definitely caffeinated so don't have too much!) 

I would definitely come here again, I think they opened pretty recently so it's a great find that won't be overly crowded for dinner. Highly recommend!
author: Sara W.

description: This place is incredible. Delicious apps, curries and kebabs. Chef Pram is the man! Highly recommend that you stop by.
author: Jason D.

description: Amazing food! I came into this place with  with low expectations, but I was completely wrong. This place fantastic! I ordered the Chicken Cashew Cream Chicken, Traditions Chicken Curry and Sizzling salmon platter. My favorite was the Chicken Cashew, but all of the dishes pleasured my taste buds. Also, the service and ambience are very welcoming.
author: Josh H.

description:
Repeating my post from google maps because these words are worth spreading:

If a comment from a Nepali adds any more weight - out of all the restaurants I have tried in this area, this is the best Nepali restaurant! 
I learned about this restaurant from a friend and decided to try it out. Some of the friends I went with were the first timers; the others had either visited Nepal or had already tried Nepali food before. Irrespective of their previous experiences (or lack thereof), they were all very impressed by the taste and the quality of the food (read fresh and healthy). And what more - the owners were so friendly and nice, it just made the whole experience absolutely delightful. 
For all the foodies and the lovers of world cultures, this is a must-go-to place!
author: Miton A.

description: Excellent food. Very affordable and friendly staff. Really clean and is  a good neighborhood. Highly recommended to take any of your family or friends visiting you from out of town or just go down to street during the evening's and have a dinner by yourself. Fit for all Occasions and the food is top-notch.
author: Amina A.

description: By far, the best restaurant I've been to in the city. The owner is the nicest guy ever!
author: Anne O.

description: I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this place.  It's run by friendly and hardworking people, the food is incredible, and the environment is warm and inviting.  Did I mention that the food is incredible?  They have the best naan in the city, and I do mean that literally.  The dishes are packed with bold flavors and they actually make it spicy if you ask for spicy (real well-done spicy, not watered down spicy or "I threw a handful of chili flakes in at the last minute" spicy).
author: Moira M.

description: Great food, awesome owner! Love the chicken dishes and the sides for the combo are amazing!
author: Sean P.

description:
My husband and I ate Nepalese cuisine a month ago for the 1st time in Windsor, CA. 
Nepalese dishes are flavorful without being too spicy and/or greasy.

We found Cuisine of Nepal which is closer to home and enjoyed the ambiance, decor and wonderful service. We started with chicken momos & lamb chhoila. Yum! Chicken cashew cream curry, butternut squash curry, seafood/ meat sizzling platter and saag tarkari were devoured and nothing to take home. We will definitely return to Cuisine of Nepal for a delicious meal.
author: Verna M.

description: Excellent food and great service.  Cuisine is similar to Indian food.  We especially enjoyed chicken and spinach curry when we ate there last night.  No wait at 6 pm on Saturday, well before it gets busy.  The owner and waiters were very attentive and helpful with advice on dishes, and the owner even told us a couple of funny stories.
author: Frank M.

description: Fantastic food, friendly and welcoming servers, and a cozy environment. Are a full vegetarian meal and was more than satisfied. Everything I want in a restaurant, and I will definitely be back.
author: Jesse S.

description: Delicious. I had gone to the old location on Cortland and always thought it was ok. I find that the ingredients at the new location seem much fresher. Everything is really good. I particularly like the lamb and pea curry dish but pretty much everything on the menu that I've had is excellent. I've also had via delivery and it came hot and was as good as eating in the restaurant.
author: Ben L.

description:
Great place for vegetarians. The small restaurant is easily missed, but worth checking out. The palak paneer is perfectly seasoned and made with FRESH spinach, not frozen, the paneer is lightly cooked--the best palak paneer in San Francisco that I've had, now that Gaylord's is gone. We also started with the dumplings and the spicy sauce was delicious. The pumpkin curry was also excellent. My Indian friend said his chai was wonderful.

The owners were attentive and friendly. At one point, the young son at our neighbor's table put his hand and a toy in our rice (no big deal), but the owner insisted on replacing our rice, naan, dal and veggie mix. His wife also gave us a complimentary mango lassi. Very sweet of them.
author: Paul S.

description: This place is one of those rare finds; cozy, clean, very good food, very good service, and the personal attention of the owner/chef.  It doesn't get much better than this.  The food is very flavorful (I went with the creamed curry chicken which was superlative; a bit better than the wife's salmon), the veggies fresh and everything thoughtfully presented.  Prices are reasonable and portions excellent (don't let the presentation on the plate fool you; that's a lot of food there!).  Try the Lentil soup as an entree; its' delicious and filling.  I will be back many times.
author: Jaime A.

description: This place is amazing!! My boyfriend and I were visiting from Los Angeles and he suggested we go eat Nepali food. This was my first time. We called in about 30 mins before closing and it would take us 20 mins to get there from San Mateo. The owner was so nice and so welcoming. He even went out to find us a parking spot. We ordered the chicken momo and the butter chicken and my boyfriend asked to make it really spicy. The owner who was also the chef recommended it would ruin the taste and that he would bring out something else for us. He brought us a bowl of very spicy chicken curry and oh lord that was so amazing. We really wanted tot drop in the next day for lunch before leaving but we had to leave early. The service is amazing, the people are extremely nice and oh my God the Food!! Dropping by every time I'm coming to San Francisco.
author: Syeda R.

description: Had the prawn curry dish.  Spice was just right,  the prawns were meaty ad sweet and the lentil and vegetable sides were too die for.    Wil definitely be back.
author: cathy e.

description: This place is a heaven on earth. The best service I have ever received at a restaurant. The owner is the cutest human being
author: Harim C.

description: Amazing and authentic food, served with tremendous care and kindness. This place is an amazing culinary experience, due to the hard work and thought of Chef Premji!! Thank you for a lovely meal!
author: Prithi T.

description: Fantastic place! We came for lunch and the food was excellent!!! I can't remember the name of our favorite dish but it was a chicken roasted for hours with spices and was truly incredible! Also the owner came out to talk to us about the food ( for example the differences between Indian and Nepalese food and talked sbout some of his recipes)   He was really friendly and made the whole meal that much more special!
author: N S.

description: This place is awesome!  Seriously delicious and I can't wait to go back. Great food quality, great flavors, friendly wait folks. The chef came around and checked in too.  Oh, and the prices were good too.  Hmmmm...feeling like Nepalese food right now actually.
author: Cho-cho H.

description:
dumpling was ok
combo meat and seafood kabob was good
author: Diane W.

description: Some of the best food we've ever eaten! Everything we tasted was was incredibly flavorful, we ate every last bit. The service was beyond kind and accommodating of all our dietary needs. The owner was vivacious, very giving of his time and very generous with his food. A real highlight of our trip to Sam Fransisco, you truly must go!
author: Harold F.

description: Great tasting curry - the minced lamb and spice level were perfect! Get the combo - for the extra $2, you get lentils and veggies.  Chef / owner was great, wait staff a little slow otherwise.
author: rich l.

description: Amazing good, I was just off from a long drive. It's refreshing, 4 stars for super long waiting for ordering, we sit there for quite long.
author: Jiazheng R.

description: I just ate here today and this place is AWESOME!!!!! Delicious!!!! I would absolutely eat here again and I will recommended it wholeheartedly. The owner came out to greet us and spent a few minutes chatting with us. He also offered us a chai tea since we had never been before. I ordered the butternut squash curry, spicy and delicious! My boyfriend had the Spicy Chicken which was even more delicious. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, with wonderful smells. Next time I'm in San Francisco I will definitely stop by.
author: RoyLynn K.

description: The food is amazing and the people who work here are awesome and kind. Cashew chicken was so tasty, as was the curry. The naan was supple and perfect.
author: Anne C.

description: fact: momos are one of the most delicious foods, and this place has momos.  there for because of the transitive property or something, this restaurant is one of the best foods.  highly recommended.
author: Kyle W.

description: Fantastic food and great service! Loved the lamb curry. Will definitely come back soon!
author: Katya F.

description: I am so glad we came to this place last night.  We had a leisurely dinner; we never felt rushed.  I haven't had Nepalese food in a long, long time and boy did I miss it!  I used to manage a store right next to a Nepalese restaurant, so I ate Nepalese at least 3 times a week and I missed it.    Cuisine of Nepal had amazing curries-we went vegetarian all night and had the mushroom one and the squash one and they were so delicious.   The staff feels like a happy family; they take really good care of you. The place really cute and cozy.   It layout and space reminds me more of a restaurant in Spain than SF.   I can't wait to go back and try more!
author: Andrea S.

description: An excellent Nepali restaurant. Delicious food, friendly people in an unassuming space
author: Dave M.

description: I have enjoyed food at Little Nepal, and was excited when I read that the owner of Little Nepal had opened this place. I am very pleased with the food. We ordered an aanp ra dahi (mango shake), Himalayan milk masala chai, samosas (crispy filled appetizers-one lamb and one vegetable), khasiko massino masu (minced lamb curry) combo, and the dwala sikar (sizzling pork ribs platter) combo. I liked the sweetness of the mango shake, which is marked as a neighborhood favourite. I think they use alfonso mango puree in it. You can choose whether you want your curry mild, medium, hot or extra hot. I don't usually eat spicy foods, so I went with mild.  The ribs were fall off the bone tender, and had remarkable flavors throughout the meat. I usually don't like to write reviews unless the place is new, and I want it to do well. (Or the place is remarkable for other reasons that I think other Yelpers have not yet picked up on.) We learned from the owner that the official opening is not until Saturday. I hope there's a good turn out. I should mention that the place is cozy. I think it's best for parties of 2 to 6.
author: S P.

description: excellent food and the combo is a great deal.  Recommend the prawn curry and momo.  The restaurant service is also very good.
author: Amit P.

description: Amazing place with amazing food!!! Prem, the owner is the ultimate host. Gave us loads complimentary drinks just because we had to wait for ~10 min for our table. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. Will definitely come back!
author: Amos B.

description: Totally shocked and impressed with the quality of this food. After ordering our dishes, the owner asked if it was our first time here; he then proceeded to offer us a glass of complimentary wine with our meal. We ordered the samosas (delicious) and the momos (amazing). They were both served hot (the dumplings were even steaming) and fresh. After being blown away by the flavors of our appetizers, we were pleasantly surprised by our entrees; we ordered a spinach curry and the sizzling platter (which lived up to its name, and was served sizzling hot!). My partner's favorite was the curry, which was super flavorful (but not over-spiced) and mine were the side dishes on our main plates (a bean/lentil stew and a vegetable medley). Our plates came with rice, a dipping sauce, naan, and 2 sides (in addition to the chicken platter and the curry). Needless to say, (and despite the generous serving sizes), we finished our plates! Highly recommend this little gem.
author: Isabel T.

description: New neighborhood favorite HANDS DOWN! Came here for dinner and was completely blown away! We ordered the Cashew Chicken and the Momos- both were unbelievably delicious. The chef, Prem, checked in on us throughout the evening and was incredibly generous with the extra wine and even packed up an extra side of vegetable curry that I fell in love with. Be sure to come with a big appetite and leave feeling full of tasty food and a new found love for Nepalese cuisine.
author: Sarah M.

description: I could just go eat the curried lentils all day every day. Chef Prem is fantastic and the absolute nicest guy too. They will take care of you here, and you are guaranteed delicious food with some flavor combinations that are almost Indian but a little more unique.
author: Cody S.

description: I had the most delicious meal of my life thus far. This is a hidden gem in San Francisco where every man women and child should dine at. It is a garuntee that by the time your stomach is full, you would feel like you are in heaven. The head chef Mr Prem is a genuine gentleman. My honor to have met him.
author: U D.

description: Came in last night for the first time with some friends from out of town. The cashew chicken curry is incredible same with the butternut squash. Prem welcomed us in made us feel like we were at home. He shared amazing stories and the staff was attentive helpful and courteous. We were the last ones in the joint. Very lovely atmosphere, service, and the food was fantastic.
author: Maddy C.

description: Top notch customer service, very flavorful food, reasonable prices and a pleasant environment. We were joking about eat24 delivering food from the kitchen to the curb then saw the owner/executive chef deliver a to-go order to a car curbside...and agreed we'd be back weekly. We ordered the combo for 2 and it was a great assortment and a lot of food and came with house wine which was very good. Samosas are huge and deliciously spicy (I usually find them flavorless elsewhere). And sauces are all fantastic. I've never had a chef seem more genuinely concerned with  how I was enjoying the meal and spice levels.
author: Tish M.

description: Fantastic food -- we had an eggplant curry and lamb kabob and pork momos to start. All of the food was delicious and the service was absolutely charming.
author: Cindy P.

description: This was one of the best dining experiences that I have had in a while! The food was outstanding, the environment welcoming and the service on point. The chef even came out to great us and make sure everything was to our liking. We ordered the dinner for two option so we could get a good taste of Nepalese cuisine. We will definitely be back for many more memorable meals.
author: Kelly M.

description: Great new gem of a restaurant. Wonderful owner, great service and delicious Nepalese food as always! Planning to go back soon!
author: Ranjeev S.

description: This place was great! We were looking for somewhere to get warm, filling and tasty food late on a Sunday night. The chef/owner personally greeted us and offered free wine since it was our first time. When we declined his offer he gave us the chai teas we ordered for free. We ordered three curries and got each as a combo, which for only a few dollars more gave us plenty of basmati rice and nan and lentils to fill out our plates and our bellies. Amazing flavors, and a great environment, we will be heading back soon!
author: Jo J.

description: Delicious food for the price. I love Indian and Nepalese cuisine, and the meals here are spot on. Service is great, they easily accommodated our party of 6 and split the check into three. The owner/chef is from Nepal and opened the restaurant in SF. Got a chance to talk with him after we ate, really nice guy. Would definitely come back here!
author: Jennifer F.

description: Not sure where to start. Cuisine of Nepal, formerly Little Nepal, has been a weekly staple. We got hooked with their takeout menu and quickly realized the owners are some of the nicest in the city.  The curry is great, rice, naan... all so good. Try new stuff, don't be afraid.
author: Matthew R.

description: Tofu tarkari, palak paneer, and tomato chutney are food of the gods. Friendliest staff I've ever met.
author: Lesley M.

description: This is one of the best restaurants in San Francisco, a new location of a favorite gem in Bernal Heights. We're always welcomed like family, the food is always perfect, and the atmosphere and friendly vibe keeps us coming back and bringing as many friends as we can. Try it once and it's really impossible not to become a regular.
author: Cindy C.

description: I cannot say enough about this place. The food is amazing with a wide variety of vegetarian options to balance the non-vegetarian items. The chef/owner treats you like family every time you walk through the for. The service is wonderful and the prices are extremely reasonable. Definitely try one of the specials as well as their selection of appetizers. I went there with a large group and we got to try several appetizers and mains which were all very flavorful and delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Jacob H.

description: This is a hidden gem! And walking distance from Glen Park. I only wish we had such a restaurant IN Glen Park. Each dish had distinct flavor. Our first experience was lunch, so we will definitely go back to try different dishes.
author: Jane R.

description: We stumbled upon this gem of a find when perusing Yelp. We came up from Los Angeles so we didn't have a clue as to where to go for dinner beyond what we read! I've never had Nepalese food before and wanted to give it a try. When we arrived, the place felt both warm and delightfully ethnic. The staff were incredibly kind and really wanted us to have a good experience. We ordered the chicken dumplings as a starter, which were like Chinese gyoza on the outside but flavorful Indian like spiced chicken on the inside! For dinner we ordered the Minced Lamb Curry and the Traditional lamb curry. We got our food and started to eat. My husband didn't talk for a good five minutes, he was so impressed with the cuisine. My lamb stew was quite flavorful and a delight to indulge in! Following our meal Prem, the chef, came to visit with us. He's a very nice guy with genuine care for his craft and his customers! We highly recommend this place and will be back for more!
author: Drew A.

description: I'm not often compelled to write a review but this place was truly exceptional.  The space is small but very comfortable and well decorated.  The smell is intoxicating from the moment you walk in.  The owner/head chef is incredibly friendly and welcoming.  We started with the momo dumplings which were delicious.  We then ordered the tofu and green beans (hot) and the sizzling rib plate (extra hot).  I love spicy food and am often disappointed when things are not as hot as advertised.  These ribs were the perfect level of heat and also one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth.  Even if you do not like spicy they would be fantastic prepared in the regular preparation.  They absolutely fall off the bone!  The tofu dish had a wonderful texture like a fried egg with a runny yoke.  I could eat the spicy cashew sauce that it was prepared in all day.  The accompaniments are all very good as well.  At the end of it all chef Pram comped our beverages, which was not necessary, especially after the exceptional food and service, but was very much appreciated.  We will definitely be coming back regularly!
author: Reid H.

description: So happy to have this restaurant in the neighborhood! The food was wonderful and the service great! While I have a palette tolerant to spicy food, others, like my mother, not so much and I didn't realize she couldn't handle even the mild dishes. The chef was over the top accommodating, making a chicken plate for her that she could handle (salt and pepper!) while I devoured my dish and eagerly sampled everyone elses! The khasi rai tulsi was phenomenal - every piece of lamb melted in my mouth. The samosas, a meal unto themselves, tempted me to want to order more to take home. The palak paneer, very mild (for me!), creamy and flavorful was a dish that could, easily, be a comforting winter mainstay. And the momo's (who doesn't love momo's?) were so fresh and accompanied by delicious sauces I couldn't get enough of! The pricing was very reasonable and the pleasant staff made the whole experience great. And they do delivery! Can't wait to try more of their dishes. We'll done!
author: Liz F.

description: the food is delicious! i brought my family and do not regret it
author: Alice M.
